<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based
on the closing sales price of $14.22 per share as of June&nbsp;29, 2007, the
aggregate market value of the voting and non-voting common equity of the
Registrant held by non-affiliates was approximately $728.4 million.</font></p>

stock, as of the latest practicable date.</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="49%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Number of shares outstanding as of</font></b></p>
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">February&nbsp;21, 2008</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Class&nbsp;A Common Stock</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="49%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:49.0%;">

  </td>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Documents Incorporated by Reference - Portions of our
definitive Proxy Statement relating to our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders
are incorporated by reference into Part&nbsp;III of this Form&nbsp;10-K.&#160; We anticipate that our Proxy Statement will
be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission within 120 days after the
end of our fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="81%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:81.64%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.24%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="2%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="4" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.4%;">

  </td>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This
report includes or incorporates forward-looking statements within the meaning
of the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&#160; We have based these forward-looking
statements on our current expectations and projections about future
events.&#160; These forward-looking statements
are subject to risks, uncertainties and assumptions about us, including, among
other things, the following risks:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General risks</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the impact of changes in national and
regional economies;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the activities of our competitors;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">terrorist acts of violence or war and
other geopolitical events;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Industry risks</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the business conditions of our
advertisers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">competition with other broadcast
television stations, radio stations, multi-channel video programming
distributors (MVPDs) and internet and broadband content providers serving in
the same markets;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">labor disputes and other union activity;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">availability and cost of programming;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effects of governmental regulation of
broadcasting or changes in those regulations and court actions interpreting
those regulations, including ownership regulations, indecency regulations,
retransmission regulations and political advertising restrictions and
regulations;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the continued viability of networks and
syndicators that provide us with programming content;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the February&nbsp;17, 2009 mandatory
transition from analog to digital over-the-air broadcasting including the
impact the transition will have on television ratings;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the broadcasting community&#146;s ability to
adopt and to accept a viable mobile digital television strategy and platform;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">competition related to the potential
implementation of regulations requiring MVPDs to carry low power television
stations&#146; programming;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Risks
specific to us</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effectiveness of our management;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to attract and maintain local
and national advertising;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to successfully renegotiate
retransmission consent agreements;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to service our outstanding debt;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to renew our FCC licenses;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to maintain our affiliation
agreements with our networks;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the popularity of syndicated programming
we purchase and network programming that we air;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">successful integration of outsourcing and
news share agreements;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the strength of ratings for our local
news broadcasts including our news sharing arrangements;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">changes in the makeup of the population
in the areas where our stations are located;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the success of our multi-channel
broadcasting initiatives strategy execution including mobile digital
television; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the results of prior year tax audits by
taxing authorities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other
matters set forth in this report and other reports filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission, including the <i>Risk
Factors</i> set forth in Item 1A of this report may also cause actual
results in the future to differ materially from those described in the
forward-looking statements.&#160; We undertake
no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a
result of new information, future events or otherwise.&#160; In light of these risks, uncertainties and
assumptions, the forward-looking statements discussed in this report might not
occur.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2730715\2529-1-be.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 27 03:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;I</font></b><a name="Parti_200435"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; BUSINESS<a name="Item1_Business_200436"></a></font></b></h2>

<h2 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are
a diversified television broadcasting company that owns or provides certain
programming, operating or sales services to more television stations than most
other commercial broadcasting groups in the United States.&#160; We currently own, provide programming and
operating services pursuant to local marketing agreements (LMAs) or provide (or
are provided) sales services pursuant to outsourcing agreements to 58
television stations in 35 markets.&#160; For the
purpose of this report, these 58 stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148; stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have a mid-size market focus and 43 of our 58 stations are located in
television designated market areas (DMAs) that rank between the 13</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-4.0pt;">th</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;and 75</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-4.0pt;">th</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;largest in the
United States.&#160; Our television station
group is diverse in network affiliation: FOX (20 stations); MyNetworkTV (17
stations); ABC (9 stations); The CW (9 stations); CBS (2 stations) and NBC (1
station).&#160; Refer to our <i>Markets and Stations </i>table later in this section for more
information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
broadcast free over-the-air programming to television viewing audiences in the
communities we serve through our local television stations.&#160; The programming that we provide consists of
network provided programs, news produced locally, local sporting events and
syndicated entertainment programs.&#160; We
provide network produced programming, which we broadcast pursuant to our
agreements with the network with which the stations are affiliated.&#160; We produce news at 17 stations in 12 markets,
including two stations where we produce news pursuant to a local news sharing
arrangement with a competitive station in that market.&#160; We have 14 stations which have local news
sharing arrangements with a competitive station in that market that produces the
news aired on our station.&#160; We provide
live local sporting events on many of our stations by acquiring the local
television broadcast rights for these events.&#160;
Additionally, we purchase and barter for popular syndicated programming
from third parties.&#160; See <i>Operating Strategy</i> later in this Item for
more information regarding the programming we provide.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
primary source of revenue is the sale of commercial inventory on our television
stations to our advertising customers.&#160;
Our objective is to meet the needs of our advertising customers by delivering
significant audiences in key demographics.&#160;
Our strategy is to achieve this objective by providing quality local
news programming and popular network and syndicated programs to our viewing
audience.&#160; We attract our national
television advertisers through a single national marketing representation firm
which has offices in New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago and Atlanta.&#160; Our local television advertisers are
attracted through the use of a local sales force at each of our television
stations, which is comprised of over 350 account executives company-wide.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are
subject to seasonal fluctuations.&#160; The
second and fourth quarter operating results are typically higher than the first
and third quarters due to increased advertising revenues.&#160; The second quarter operating results are
typically higher than the first and third quarters primarily because
advertising expenditures are increased in anticipation of consumer spending on &#147;summer
related&#148; items such as home improvements, lawn care and travel plans.&#160; The fourth quarter operating results are
typically higher than first and third quarters due to anticipation of holiday
season spending by consumers.&#160; Our
operating results are usually subject to cyclical fluctuations from political
advertising.&#160; In the past, political
spending has been significantly higher in the even-number years due to the
cyclicality of political advertising.&#160; In
addition, every four years, political spending is elevated further due to the
advertising revenue preceding the presidential election.&#160; Because of this cyclicality, there has been a
significant difference in our operating results when comparing even-numbered
years&#146; performance to the odd-numbered years&#146; performance.&#160; We believe political advertising will
continue to be a strong advertising category in our industry.&#160; We believe 2008 will be an exceptional year
for television broadcasting.&#160; According
to TNS Media Intelligence&#146;s January&nbsp;2008 report titled, &#147;TNS Media
Intelligence forecasts 4.2% increase in U.S. advertising spending in 2008,&#148; in
2008 spot TV advertising is expected to grow 9.9% over 2007.&#160; The report indicates that overall advertising
spending in all mediums, &#147;will be driven predominately by the powerful
combination of summer Olympics and record-setting levels of political
advertising.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Over the last few years,
we have been earning revenue from our retransmission consent agreements through
payments from the MVPDs in our markets.&#160;
The MVPDs are local cable companies, satellite television and local telecommunication
video providers.&#160; The revenues primarily
represent payments from the MVPDs for access to our signal so they may
rebroadcast directly to and charge their subscribers.&#160; We have seen this revenue category grow
significantly in 2007 as we successfully negotiated favorable payment terms in
our retransmission consent agreements with the MVPDs.&#160; Certain agreements are set to expire in 2008
and therefore, contractual negotiations are expected.&#160; We expect to continue to generate revenues
from retransmission consent agreements at terms as favorable as or more
favorable than our existing agreements upon the expiration of those
agreements.&#160; Our retransmission consent
agreements include automatic annual fee escalators.&#160; Additionally, as mobile television develops,
we may be able to generate additional revenue streams through agreements with
portable device service providers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2730715\2529-1-be.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 27 03:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mobile digital television holds tremendous potential
for the television broadcasting industry.&#160;
In February&nbsp;2009, over-the-air television broadcasting in the U.S.
is scheduled to complete the transition from high power analog transmissions to
digital transmissions.&#160; We are
enthusiastic about the potential uses of our digital spectrum.&#160; With the right technology, digital
transmissions will allow us to broadcast our signals to portable devices such
as cell phones, laptop computers, car televisions and other hand-held
devices.&#160; According to BIA Financial
Network&#146;s January&nbsp;2008 report titled, &#147;Study of the impact of multiple
systems for mobile/handheld digital television,&#148; &#147;BIA<i>fn </i>estimates
that broadcast television could reap an additional $2 billion in annual revenue
by 2012 delivering content to mobile and handheld devices if an industry
standard is adopted and technology deployed quickly.&#148;&#160; We believe that mobile television will be
available to the public as early as the first half of 2009.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are
a Maryland corporation formed in 1986.&#160;
Our principal offices are located at 10706 Beaver Dam Road, Hunt Valley,
Maryland 21030.&#160; Our telephone number is
(410) 568-1500 and our website address is www.sbgi.net.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TELEVISION BROADCASTING</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Markets and
Stations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We own and operate, provide programming services to,
provide sales services to or have agreed to acquire the following television
stations:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741368\2529-1-bg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 03:04 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rankings are based on the relative size of a station&#146;s
designated market area (DMA) among the 210 generally recognized DMAs in the
United States as estimated by Nielsen as of November&nbsp;2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;O&nbsp;&amp; O&#148; refers to stations that we own and
operate.&#160; &#147;LMA&#148; refers to stations to
which we provide programming services pursuant to a local marketing
agreement.&#160; &#147;OSA&#148; refers to stations to
which we provide or receive sales services pursuant to an outsourcing
agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When we negotiate the terms of our affiliation
agreements with each network, we negotiate on behalf of all of our stations
affiliated with that network simultaneously.&#160;
This results in substantially similar terms for our stations, including
the expiration date of the affiliation agreement.&#160; A summary of these expiration dates is as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="91%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:91.0%;">

  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Affiliate</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.56%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="86%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:86.94%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Expiration Date</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <td width="8%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:8.48%;">

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.56%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="86%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:86.94%;">

  except KFXA, which expires on June&nbsp;30, 2010</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="86%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:86.94%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All 17 agreements expire on September&nbsp;4, 2011</font></p>

  <td width="8%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:8.48%;">

  </td>

  <td width="8%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:8.48%;">

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The first number represents the rank of each station
in its market and is based upon the November&nbsp;2007 Nielsen estimates of the
percentage of persons tuned into each station in the market from 6:00&nbsp;a.m.
to 2:00&nbsp;a.m., Monday through Sunday.&#160;
The second number represents the estimated number of television stations
designated by Nielsen as &#147;local&#148; to the DMA, excluding public television
stations and stations that do not meet the minimum Nielsen reporting standards
(weekly cumulative audience of at least 0.1%) for the Monday through Sunday
6:00&nbsp;a.m. to 2:00&nbsp;a.m. time period as of November&nbsp;2007.&#160; This information is provided to us in a
summary report by Katz Television Group.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The license assets for this station are currently
owned by Bay Television,&nbsp;Inc., a related party.&#160; See <i>Note 12.</i>  <i>Related Person Transactions</i>, in the Notes to our
Consolidated Financial Statements for more information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We, or subsidiaries of Cunningham Broadcasting
Company (Cunningham), timely filed applications for renewal of these licenses
with the FCC.&#160; Unrelated third parties
have filed petitions to deny or informal objections against such
applications.&#160; We opposed the petitions
to deny and the informal objections and those applications are currently
pending.&#160; See <i>Note 11.</i>
<i>Commitments and Contingencies</i>, in the
Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements for more information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">g)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We timely filed applications for renewal of these
licenses with the FCC.&#160; FCC staff have
informed us that the applications have not yet been granted because unrelated
third parties have filed informal objections against the stations based on
alleged violations of either the FCC&#146;s sponsorship identification or indecency
rules.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">h)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The license assets for these stations are currently
owned by a subsidiary of Cunningham.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into an outsourcing agreement
with the unrelated third party owner of WNAB-TV to provide certain
non-programming related sales, operational and administrative services to
WNAB-TV.&#160; Our application to acquire this
FCC license is pending FCC approval.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">j)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WDBB-TV simulcasts the programming broadcast
on WTTO-TV pursuant to a programming services agreement.&#160; The station rank applies to the combined
viewership of these stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">k)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into outsourcing agreements with
unrelated third parties, under which the unrelated third parties provide
certain non-programming related sales, operational and managerial services to
these stations.&#160; We continue to own all
of the assets of these stations and to program and control each station&#146;s
operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">l)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WICD-TV, a satellite of WICS-TV under FCC
rules, simulcasts all of the programming aired on WICS-TV except the news broadcasts.&#160; WICD-TV airs its own news broadcasts.&#160; The station rank applies to the combined
viewership of these stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">m)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;1, 2008, we entered into an
outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third party owner of KFXA-TV to
provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and administrative
services to KFXA-TV.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741368\2529-1-bg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 03:04 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Strategy</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
operating strategy includes the following elements:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Programming to Attract Viewership</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
We seek to target our programming offerings to attract viewership, to
meet the needs of the communities in which we serve and to meet the needs of
our advertising customers.&#160; In pursuit of
this strategy, we seek to obtain, at attractive prices, popular syndicated programming
that is complementary to each station&#146;s network programming.&#160; We also seek to broadcast live local and
national sporting events that would appeal to a large segment of the local
community.&#160; Moreover, we produce news at
17 stations in 12 markets, including two stations which have a local news
sharing agreement with a competitive station in that market.&#160; We have 14 stations which have local news
sharing arrangements with a competitive station in that market, which produces
the news aired on our station.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Attract and Retain High Quality Management</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
We believe that much of our success is due to our ability to attract and
retain highly skilled and motivated managers at both the corporate and local
station levels.&#160; We provide a combination
of base salary, long-term incentive compensation and, where appropriate, cash
bonus pay designed to be competitive with comparable employers in the
television broadcast industry.&#160; A
significant portion of the compensation available to our Chief Operating
Officer, sales vice presidents, group managers, general managers, sales
managers and other station managers is based on their exceeding certain
operating results.&#160; We also provide some
of our corporate and station managers with deferred compensation plans and
equity awards.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing Local Franchises</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We believe
the greatest opportunity for a sustainable and growing customer base lies
within our local communities.&#160; Therefore,
we have focused on developing a strong local sales force at each of our
television stations, which is comprised of over 350 account executives
company-wide.&#160; Excluding political
advertising revenue, 66.3% of our net time sales were local for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, compared to 64.7% in 2006.&#160; Our
goal is to grow our local revenues by increasing our market share and by
developing new business opportunities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Local News</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We believe
that the production and broadcasting of local news is an important link to the
community and an aid to a station&#146;s efforts to expand its viewership.&#160; In addition, local news programming can
provide access to advertising sources targeted specifically to local news
viewers.&#160; We assess the anticipated
benefits and costs of producing local news prior to the introduction of local
news at our stations because a significant investment in capital equipment is
required and substantial operating expenses are incurred in introducing,
developing and producing local news programming.&#160; We also continuously review the performance
of our existing news operations to make sure they are economically viable.&#160; In 2008, we expect to provide high definition
newscasts in four of our key competitive news markets.&#160; In addition, we plan to provide high
definition newscasts in an additional four markets in each of 2009 and 2010.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our local news
initiatives are an important part of our strategy that has resulted in our
entering into 16 local news sharing arrangements with other television
broadcasters.&#160; We are the provider of
news services in two instances; however, in 14 of our news share arrangements,
we are the recipient of services.&#160; We
believe news share arrangements generally provide both higher viewer ratings
and revenues for the station receiving the news and generate a profit for the
news share provider.&#160; Generally, both
parties and the local community are beneficiaries of these arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing New Business</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We are always
striving to develop new business models to complement or enhance our existing
television broadcast business.&#160; During
the past few years, we have built a profitable direct mail business at many of
our stations using, for the most part, our existing sales force.&#160; With the success of our direct mail program,
which generated $5.9 million in revenues in 2007, we have developed other
initiatives that will give us an additional competitive advantage.&#160; We continue to explore new opportunities and
plan to implement new initiatives in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Retransmission Consent Agreements</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
We have retransmission consent agreements with MVPDs, such as cable,
satellite and telecommunications operators in our markets.&#160; MVPDs compensate us for the right to
retransmit our broadcast signals.&#160; Our
successful negotiations with MVPDs have created agreements that now produce
meaningful sustainable revenue streams.&#160;
During 2007, our retransmission consent agreements, including the
advertising component, generated $58.9 million in total broadcast
revenues.&#160; This represents a 135%
increase over 2006 results.&#160; This growth
trend will not continue at this rate since most of the MVPDs that we conduct business
with our now under contract.&#160; Certain
agreements are set to expire in 2008 and therefore, contractual negotiations
are expected.&#160; We expect to continue to
generate revenues from retransmission consent agreements at terms as favorable
as or more favorable than our existing agreements upon the expiration of those
agreements.&#160; Our retransmission consent
agreements include automatic annual fee escalators. Additionally, as mobile
television develops, we may be able to generate additional revenue streams
through agreements with portable device service providers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Ownership Duopolies and Utilization of Local Marketing
Agreements</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We have sought to increase our revenues and
improve our margins through the ownership of two stations in a single market,
called a duopoly, and by providing programming services pursuant to a LMA to a
second station in eight DMAs where we already own one station.&#160; Duopolies and LMAs allow us to realize
significant economies of scale in marketing, programming, overhead and capital expenditures.&#160; We also believe these arrangements </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741368\2529-1-bg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 03:04 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">enable us to air popular
programming and contribute to the diversity of programming within each
DMA.&#160; Although under the FCC ownership rules&nbsp;released
in June&nbsp;2003, we would be allowed to continue to program most of the
stations with which we have a LMA, in the absence of a waiver, the 2003 rules&nbsp;would
require us to terminate or modify three of our LMAs.&#160; Although there can be no assurances, we have
studied the application of the 2003 rules&nbsp;to our markets and believe we
are qualified for waivers.&#160; Under the
ownership rules&nbsp;established in 2008, we may be required to terminate or
modify three of our LMAs that we executed after November&nbsp;5, 1996.&#160; We also may be required to terminate or
modify three other LMAs that we executed prior to November&nbsp;5, 1996, if the
FCC subsequently initiates a case-by-case review of those LMAs and determines
not to extend the grandfathering period.&#160;
For additional information, refer to <i>Risk
Factors - Changes in Rules&nbsp;on Television Ownership</i>, and <i>Risk Factors - The FCC&#146;s multiple ownership rules&nbsp;limit
our ability to operate multiple television stations in some markets and may
result in a reduction in our revenue or prevent us from reducing costs.&#160; Changes in these rules&nbsp;may threaten our
existing strategic approach to certain television markets</i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use of Outsourcing Agreements</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; In addition
to our LMAs, we currently operate under four (and may seek opportunities for
additional) outsourcing agreements in which our stations provide or are
provided various non-programming related services such as sales, operational
and managerial services to or by other stations.&#160; Pursuant to these agreements, our stations in
Nashville, Tennessee and Cedar Rapids, Iowa currently provide services to
another station in the market and another party provides services to our
stations in Peoria/Bloomington, Illinois and Rochester, New York.&#160; We believe the outsourcing structure allows
stations to achieve operational efficiencies and economies of scale, which
should otherwise improve broadcast cash flow and competitive positions.&#160; While television joint sales agreements
(JSAs) are not currently attributable, as that term is defined by the FCC, on August&nbsp;2,
2004, the FCC released a notice of proposed rulemaking seeking comments on its
tentative conclusion that television joint sales agreements should be
attributable.&#160; We cannot predict the
outcome of this proceeding, nor can we predict how many changes, together with
possible changes to ownership rules, would apply to our existing outsourcing
agreements.&#160; See the <i>Local
Marketing Agreements</i> section below.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Multi-Channel
Digital Broadcasting.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FCC rules&nbsp;allow
broadcasters to transmit additional digital channels within the spectrum
allocated to each FCC license holder.&#160;
This provides viewers with additional programming alternatives at no
additional cost to them.&#160; Four of our
television stations are experimenting with broadcasting a second digital
channel in accordance with these rules, airing various alternative programming
formats.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In Baltimore, where our corporate offices are located,
we are airing a secondary digital channel comprised of classic television
programming, religious programming and simulcasting of our primary digital
channel.&#160; In the three other markets, we
have a similar format along with MyNetwork TV programming.&#160; In addition, as noted below, we believe
mobile digital television will serve as a tremendous use of our additional
digital spectrum.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We may
consider other alternative programming formats that we could air using our
multi-channel digital spectrum space with the goal towards achieving higher
profits and community service.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mobile Digital Television.&#160;
</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a
member of the Open Mobile Video Coalition, which is a voluntary association of
television broadcasters whose mission is to accelerate the development of
mobile digital broadcast television.&#160; We
believe mobile digital television will become a viable use of our local
stations&#146; programming.&#160;&#160; We believe that
in the near future it will be possible to broadcast digital television to
numerous mobile devices including cell phones, laptop computers, video screens
in vehicles, portable video players and other portable devices.&#160; We believe that the technical ability to
receive our television broadcast content on mobile devices will be attractive
to individuals.&#160; We believe this
technology, if successfully implemented, could create an entirely new revenue
stream for television broadcasters.&#160; Due
to the complexity of the technology, the disparate competitive interests in
developing a technology standardization, the availability of other competing
technologies and the number of stakeholders involved including cellular network
operators, there are risks associated with successfully monetizing this
platform.&#160; Although the technology and
business plan are in process, indications are that mobile digital television
could be broadcasted as early as 2009.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Control of Operating and Programming Costs</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
By employing a disciplined approach to managing programming acquisition
and other costs, we have been able to achieve operating margins that we believe
are very competitive within the television broadcast industry.&#160; We believe our national reach of
approximately 22% of the country provides us with a strong position to
negotiate with programming providers and, as a result, the opportunity to
purchase high quality programming at more favorable prices.&#160; Moreover, we emphasize control of each of our
station&#146;s programming and operating costs through program-specific profit
analysis, detailed budgeting, regionalization of staff and detailed long-term
planning models.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Popular Sporting Events</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Our CW and
MyNetworkTV affiliated stations generally face fewer preemption restrictions on
broadcasting live local sporting events compared with FOX, ABC, CBS and NBC
affiliates, which are required to broadcast a greater number of hours of
programming supplied by the networks.&#160; At
some of our stations, we have been able to acquire local television broadcast
rights for certain sporting events, including NBA basketball, Major League
Baseball, NFL football, NHL hockey, ACC basketball and both Big Ten and SEC
football and basketball and high school sports.&#160;
We seek to expand our sports broadcasting in DMAs only as profitable
opportunities arise.&#160; In addition, our
stations that are affiliated with FOX, ABC, CBS and NBC broadcast certain NBA
basketball, Major League Baseball games, NFL football games, NHL hockey games
and NASCAR races, as well as other popular sporting events.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
