<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We increased our quarterly dividend rate
from 12.5 cents per share to 15 cents per share beginning with the March&nbsp;2007
dividend payment.&#160; The quarterly dividend
rate per share increased again to 17.5 cents per share on October&nbsp;31,
2007;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our retransmission consent agreements,
including the advertising component, generated $58.9 million in total net
broadcast revenues during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to
$25.1 million during the same period in 2006;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Excluding political, local revenues
increased 2.6% and national revenues decreased 4.6% during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 versus the same period in 2006;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2007, interest expense decreased
16.8%, primarily due to the full redemption of our 8.75% Notes and the partial
redemption of our 8.0% Notes during 2007; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Market share survey results reflect that
our stations&#146; share of the television advertising market in 2007 increased to
17.4%, from 16.8% in 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Highlights</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2008, we repurchased in
the open market $6.9 million face value of our 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes,
due 2012;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;1, 2008, we purchased
the non-license assets of KFXA-TV in Cedar Rapids, Iowa for $17.1 million in
cash and the right to purchase licensed assets, pending FCC approval, for $1.9
million.&#160; Our CBS affiliate, KGAN-TV in
Cedar Rapids, Iowa, will provide sales and other non-programming related
services to KFXA-TV pursuant to a joint sales agreement;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2008, we increased our
quarterly dividend rate to 20 cents per share; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2008, we have invested $4.5 million
primarily in developmental land and $3.0 million in the Patriot Capital II
fund, which provides financing to small businesses.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Industry Trends</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Political advertising increases in
even-numbered years, such as 2006, due to the advertising expenditures from
candidates running in local and national elections.&#160; In every fourth year, such as 2008, political
advertising is elevated further due to the presidential election;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Federal Communications Commission
(FCC) has mandated that beginning February&nbsp;17, 2009, all broadcast
television stations must broadcast using only a digital signal and will no
longer be able to broadcast using an analog signal;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The FCC has permitted broadcast
television stations to use their digital spectrum for a wide variety of
services including multi-channel broadcasts.&#160;
The FCC &#147;must carry&#148; rules&nbsp;only apply to a station&#146;s primary
digital stream;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A number of other broadcasters, including
Sinclair, have joined together in what is known as the Open Mobile Video
Coalition to promote the development of mobile digital broadcasting
applications.&#160; We believe there is
potential for broadcasters to garner payment for retransmission of their
signals to mobile devices;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retransmission consent rules&nbsp;provide
a mechanism for broadcasters to seek payment from multi-channel video
programming distributors (MVPDs) who carry broadcasters&#146; signals.&#160; Recognition of the value provided by
broadcasters, including digital and high definition signals and popular network
programming, in addition to increased competition among video delivery
providers, has generated a sustainable, annual payment stream which we expect
to continue to grow;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Automotive-related advertising is a
significant portion of our total net revenues in all periods presented and
these revenues have been trending downward in recent years;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Many broadcasters are enhancing/upgrading
their websites to use the internet to deliver rich media content, such as
newscasts and weather updates, to attract advertisers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Seasonal advertising increases in the
second and fourth quarters due to the advertising expenditures related to the
anticipation of certain seasonal and holiday spending by consumers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising revenue related to the
Olympics occurs in even numbered years and the Super Bowl is aired on a
different network each year.&#160; Both of
these popularly viewed events can have an impact on our advertising revenues;
and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation from networks to their
affiliates in exchange for broadcasting of network programming has
significantly declined in recent years and may be eliminated in the future in
lieu of alternative network and affiliate relationships.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Sources of Revenues and Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Most
of our revenues are generated from the transactional &#147;spot&#148; market rather than
the traditional &#147;up front&#148; and &#147;scatter&#148; markets that networks access. These
operating revenues are derived from local and national advertisers and, to a
much lesser extent, from political advertisers.&#160; During 2007, we began to
generate significant new revenues from our retransmission consent
agreements.&#160; These agreements have helped
to produce a new, viable revenue stream that has replaced the steady decline in
revenues from television network compensation while also significantly
exceeding such previous sources of revenue.&#160; While we </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741368\2529-1-bm.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 03:09 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">expect revenues from our
retransmission consent agreements to continue to grow over the next fiscal year
and beyond, we do not expect the revenues to significantly increase, such as
the increase from 2006 to 2007, since most of our significant MVPDs are now
under contract.&#160; However, as contracts
expire we expect to negotiate favorable terms to grow our revenue stream.&#160; In addition, most contracts contain automatic
annual fee escalators.&#160; Our revenues from
local advertisers have continued to trend upward and revenues from national
advertisers have continued to trend downward when measured as a percentage of
total broadcast revenues.&#160; We believe
this trend is the result of our focus on increasing local advertising revenues
as a percentage of total advertising revenues, combined with a decrease in overall
spending by national advertisers and an increase in the number of competitive
media outlets providing national advertisers multiple alternatives in which to
advertise their goods or services.&#160; Our
efforts to mitigate the effect of these increasingly competitive media outlets
for national advertisers include continuing our efforts to increase local
revenues and developing innovative sales and marketing strategies to sell
traditional and non-traditional services to our advertisers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This
discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations is
based on our consolidated financial statements which have been prepared in
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.&#160; The preparation of these financial statements
requires us to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amount of
assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses and related disclosure of contingent
assets and liabilities.&#160; On an on-going
basis, we evaluate our estimates including those related to bad debts, program
contract costs, intangible assets, income taxes, property and equipment,
investments and derivative contracts.&#160; We
base our estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions
that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of
which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets
and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources.&#160; These estimates have been consistently
applied for all years presented in this report and in the past we have not
experienced material differences between these estimates and actual
results.&#160; However, because future events
and their effects cannot be determined with certainty, actual results could
differ from our estimates and such differences could be material.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have identified the policies below as critical to our business operations and
to the understanding of our results of operations.&#160; For a detailed discussion of the application
of these and other accounting policies, see <i>Note
1. Nature of Operations and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies,</i>
in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue
Recognition</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Advertising revenues, net of agency and
national representatives&#146; commissions, are recognized in the period during
which time spots are aired.&#160; All other
revenues are recognized as services are provided.&#160; The revenues realized from station barter
arrangements are recorded as the programs are aired at the estimated fair value
of the advertising airtime given in exchange for the program rights.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
retransmission consent agreements contain both advertising and retransmission
consent elements that are paid in cash.&#160;
We have determined that our agreements are revenue arrangements with
multiple deliverables and fall within the scope of EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-21, <i>Revenue Arrangements with Multiple Deliverables</i> (EITF
00-21).&#160; Advertising and retransmission
consent deliverables sold under our agreements are separated into different
units of accounting based on fair value.&#160;&#160;
Revenue applicable to the advertising element of the arrangement is
recognized consistent with the advertising revenue policy noted above.&#160; Revenue applicable to the retransmission
consent element of the arrangement is recognized ratably over the life of the
agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allowance for Doubtful Accounts</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
We maintain an allowance for doubtful accounts for estimated losses
resulting from extending credit to our customers that are unable to make
required payments.&#160; If the economy and/or
the financial condition of our customers were to deteriorate, resulting in an
impairment of their ability to make payments, additional allowances may be
required.&#160; For example, a 10% increase of
the balance of our allowance for doubtful accounts as of December&nbsp;31,
2007, would reduce net income available to common shareholders by approximately
$0.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Program Contract Costs</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We have
agreements with distributors for the rights to televise programming over
contract periods, which generally run from one to seven years.&#160; Contract payments are made in installments
over terms that are generally equal to or shorter than the contract
period.&#160; Each contract is recorded as an
asset and a liability at an amount equal to its gross cash contractual
commitment when the license period begins and the program is available for its
first showing.&#160; The portion of program
contracts which become payable within one year is reflected as a current
liability in the consolidated balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
programming rights are reflected in the consolidated balance sheets at the
lower of unamortized cost or estimated net realizable value (NRV).&#160; Estimated NRVs are based on management&#146;s
expectation of future advertising revenue, net of sales commissions, to be
generated by the remaining program material available under the contract
terms.&#160; In conjunction with our NRV
analysis of programming rights reflected in our consolidated balance sheets, we
perform similar analysis on future programming rights yet to be reflected in
our consolidated balance sheets and establish allowances when future payments
exceed the estimated NRV.&#160; Amortization
of program contract costs is generally computed using a four-year accelerated
method or a straight-line method, depending on the length of the contract.&#160; Program contract costs estimated by
management to be amortized within one year are classified as current
assets.&#160; Program contract liabilities are
typically paid on a scheduled basis and are not reflected by adjustments for
amortization or estimated NRV.&#160; If our
estimate of future advertising revenues declines, then additional write downs
to NRV may be required.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741368\2529-1-bm.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 03:09 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Valuation
of Goodwill, Long-Lived Assets and Intangible Assets</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
We periodically evaluate our goodwill, broadcast licenses, long-lived
assets and intangible assets for potential impairment indicators.&#160; Our judgments regarding the existence of
impairment indicators are based on estimated future cash flows, market
conditions, operating performance of our stations and legal factors.&#160; Future events could cause us to conclude that
impairment indicators exist and that the net book value of long-lived assets
and intangible assets is impaired.&#160; Any
resulting impairment loss could have a material adverse impact on our
consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have determined our broadcast licenses to be indefinite-lived intangible assets
under Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;142, <i>Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</i>,
which requires such assets to be tested for impairment on an annual basis along
with our goodwill.&#160; We test our broadcast
licenses and goodwill by estimating the fair market value of the broadcast
licenses, or the net assets for each of our markets in the case of goodwill,
using a combination of quoted market prices, observed earnings multiples paid
for comparable television stations, discounted cash flow models and
appraisals.&#160; We then compare the
estimated fair market value to the book value of these assets to determine if
an impairment exists.&#160; Our discounted
cash flow model is based on our judgment of future market conditions within
each designated marketing area, as well as discount rates that would be used by
market participants in an arms-length transaction.&#160; Future events could cause us to conclude that
market conditions have declined or discount rates have increased to the extent
that our broadcast licenses and/or goodwill could be impaired.&#160; Any resulting impairment loss could have a
material adverse impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations and consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
Taxes.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities based
on the differences between the financial statements carrying amounts and the
tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160; We
provide a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets relating to various
federal and state net operating losses (NOL) that are carried forward.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, valuation
allowances have been provided for a substantial amount of our available federal
and state NOLs.&#160; We evaluate the need and
extent of a valuation allowance based on the expected timing of the reversals
of existing temporary book/tax differences, alternative tax strategies and
projected future taxable income.&#160; If we
are unable to generate sufficient taxable income, if there is a material change
in our projected taxable income, or if there is a change in our ability to use
NOL carryforwards due to changes in federal and state laws, we will make any
necessary adjustments to the valuation allowance.&#160; Management periodically performs a comprehensive
review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews, the status of ongoing
audits and the expiration of applicable statute of limitations, accruals are
adjusted as necessary in accordance with the recognition provisions of FASB
Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty
in Income Taxes</i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restructuring Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, we incurred costs in our broadcast
segment associated with restructuring the news operations at certain of our
stations.&#160; Specifically, on or before March&nbsp;31,
2006, we ceased our locally-produced news broadcasts in nine of our markets
and, consequently, let go our news employees and cancelled our news-related
contracts.&#160; We recorded restructuring
charges in station production expenses.&#160;
As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, there was no remaining unpaid balance
related to the restructuring plan.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007,
the Financial Standards Accounting Board (FASB) issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;159, <i>The Fair Value Option for
Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities&#151;Including an amendment</i>  <i>of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;115</i> (SFAS 159).&#160; The fair value option established by this
Statement permits all entities to choose to measure eligible items at fair
value at specified election dates.&#160;
Unrealized gains and losses on items for which the fair value option has
been elected are to be reported in earnings at each subsequent reporting
date.&#160; This Statement is effective for
our fiscal year beginning January&nbsp;1, 2008.&#160;
We currently have no plans to apply the option provisions of SFAS 159 to
our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued FASB Staff Position (FSP) FIN 48-1, <i>Definition
of &#145;Settlement&#146;</i>  <i>in FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48</i>.&#160; This FSP amends FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48,
<i>Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes </i>(FIN
48), to provide guidance on how an enterprise should determine whether a tax
position is effectively settled for the purpose of recognizing previously
unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; The guidance
in this FSP should be applied by companies upon the initial adoption of FIN
48.&#160; We adopted FIN 48 in 2007, see <i>Note 10. Income Taxes </i>for more information.&#160; This FSP and FIN 48 did not have a material
impact on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2007, the
Emerging Issues Task Force (EITF) issued the consensus on Issue No.&nbsp;06-11,
<i>Accounting for Income Tax Benefits of Dividends on
Share-Based Payment Awards</i>.&#160;
The provisions require companies to recognize the tax benefits of
dividends on unvested share-based payments in equity and reclassify the tax
benefits from additional paid-in capital to the income statement when the
related award is forfeited.&#160; The
provisions are effective prospectively starting January&nbsp;1, 2008.&#160; The impact of this issue will not have a
material effect to our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bo.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued FSP, APB 14-a, an interpretation of APB Opinion No.&nbsp;14, <i>Accounting for Convertible Debt and Debt Issued with Stock Purchase
Warrants</i>.&#160; This proposed FSP
provides clarification on the accounting for convertible debt instruments that
may be settled in cash upon conversion, including partial cash settlement.&#160; If issued, the guidance could significantly impact
the accounting for instruments commonly referred to as Instrument C, which is
structured so that upon conversion, the principal amount of the obligation is
paid in cash and the conversion spread is settled in cash or shares.&#160; This proposed FSP would require the issuer to
bifurcate a component of the debt and classify that component in shareholder&#146;s
equity, then accrete the resulting discount on the debt resulting in interest
expense equal to the issuer&#146;s nonconvertible debt borrowing rate.&#160; The expected effective date is for fiscal
years beginning after January&nbsp;1, 2009 and is required to be retroactively
applied.&#160; Such a change in the accounting
for convertible debt securities could have a material impact on our
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued FSP FAS 142-f, <i>Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets</i>.&#160; This
proposed FSP amends the factors that should be considered in developing renewal
or extension assumptions used to determine the useful life of an intangible
asset under FASB Statement No.&nbsp;142, <i>Goodwill and Other
Intangibles </i>(FAS 142).&#160; The
FSP aims to improve the consistency between the useful life of an intangible
asset as determined under FAS 142 and the period of expected cash flows used to
measure the fair value of the asset under FASB Statement No.&nbsp;141, <i>Business Combinations</i>, and other applicable accounting
literature.&#160; As a result of this FSP,
entities generally will be able to align the assumptions used for valuing an
intangible asset with those used to determine its useful life. This FSP will be
effective for financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning after June&nbsp;15,
2008 and interim periods within those fiscal years.&#160; We are currently evaluating the effect of
this statement on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No 141 (revised
2007), <i>Business Combinations</i> (FAS 141(R)).&#160; FAS 141(R)&nbsp;requires an acquiring entity
to recognize all the assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a transaction
at the acquisition-date fair value with limited exceptions.&#160; In addition to new disclosure requirements,
FAS 141(R)&nbsp;also makes the following significant changes: acquisition costs
are expensed as incurred, noncontrolling interests are valued at fair value at
the acquisition date, acquired contingencies are recorded at fair value at the
acquisition date and subsequently re-measured at either the higher of such
amount or the amount determined under existing guidance for non-acquired
contingencies, in-process research and development costs are recorded at fair
value as an indefinite-lived intangible asset at the acquisition date,
restructuring costs are expensed subsequent to the acquisition date and changes
in deferred tax asset valuation allowances and income tax uncertainties after
the acquisition date generally affect income tax expense.&#160; This statement is effective for business
combinations in which the acquisition date is on or after the beginning of the
first annual reporting period beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008 and
early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We are
currently evaluating the effect of this statement on our consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp; 160, <i>Noncontrolling Interests in Consolidated Financial Statements, an
Amendment of ARB No.&nbsp;51 </i>(FAS 160).&#160; This statement requires the recognition of a
noncontrolling interest (minority interest) as equity in the consolidated
financial statements and separate from the parent&#146;s equity.&#160; The amount of net income attributable to the
noncontrolling interest will be included in consolidated net income on the face
of the income statement.&#160; Changes in a
parent&#146;s ownership interest that result in deconsolidation of a subsidiary will
result in the recognition of a gain or loss in net income when the subsidiary
is deconsolidated.&#160; FAS 160 also includes
expanded disclosure requirements regarding the interests of the parent and its
noncontrolling interest.&#160; The statement
is effective for fiscals years, and interim periods within those fiscal years,
beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008.&#160;
We are currently evaluating the effect of this statement on our
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2008,
the FASB issued FSP FAS 157-1 and FSP FAS 157-2, <i>Fair Value
Measurements</i>.&#160; FSP FAS 157-1
amends FASB Statement No.&nbsp;157, <i>Fair Value Measurements </i>(FAS
157) to exclude FASB Statement No.&nbsp;13, <i>Accounting for Leases</i>
(FAS 13), and its related interpretive accounting pronouncements that address
leasing transactions.&#160; The FASB decided
to exclude leasing transactions covered by FAS 13 (except those arising from a
business combination) in order to allow it to more broadly consider the use of
fair value measurements for these transactions as part of its project to
comprehensively reconsider the accounting for leasing transactions.&#160; FAS 157-2 delays the effective date of FAS
157 for all non-financial assets and non-financial liabilities, except those that
are recognized or disclosed at fair value in the financial statements on a
recurring basis.&#160;&#160; The FSP states that
the application of FAS 157 for non-financial assets and non-financial
liabilities will be delayed until fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15,
2008 and interim periods within those fiscal years.&#160; FAS 157 was issued in September&nbsp;2006 and
defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value and
expands disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160; This standard is effective for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; The application
of FAS 157 will not have a material impact on our consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>

<div align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bo.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, this
discussion is related to the results of our continuing operations, except for
discussions regarding our cash flows (which also include the results of our
discontinued operations).&#160; Unless
otherwise indicated, references in this discussion to 2007, 2006 and 2005 are
to our fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; Additionally, any
references to the first, second, third or fourth quarters are to the three
months ended March&nbsp;31, June&nbsp;30, September&nbsp;30 and December&nbsp;31,
respectively, for the year being discussed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Broadcast Revenues</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Set
forth below are the principal types of broadcast revenues from continuing
operations received by our stations for the periods indicated and the
percentage contribution of each type to our total gross broadcast revenues (in
millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.84%;">

  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:6.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2007, 2006 and 2005, $14.5 million, $4.7 million
and $3.4 million, respectively, in revenues generated from our retransmission
consent agreements are categorized as local/regional advertising rather than as
retransmission consent revenues pursuant to EITF 00-21.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
primary types of programming and their approximate percentages of 2007 net
broadcast revenues from continuing operations were syndicated programming (40.2%),
network programming (21.1%), news (14.7%), direct advertising programming (8.1%),
sports programming (5.6%). Additionally, other types of revenue and their
approximate percentages of 2007 net broadcast revenues from continuing
operations were retransmission consent (7.1%), network compensation (1.0%) and
other (2.2%).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table presents our time sales revenue
from continuing operations, net of agency commissions, by network affiliates
for the past three years (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.24%;">

  </td>

  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:8.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.32%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:5.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">558.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:5.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">584.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">568.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.32%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:8.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.38%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006 and 2005, several of our
stations switched affiliations.&#160; We have
reclassified the revenue for those stations in prior years for comparability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006 includes significantly more
political revenue than 2007 and 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005, we entered into an agreement
to sell our FOX station in Tri-Cities, Tennessee.&#160; During 2007, we entered into an agreement to
sell our ABC station in Springfield, Massachusetts.&#160; The time sales from these stations are not
included in this table because they are accounted for as time sales from
discontinued operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bo.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006, our composition
of network affiliates changed as a result of our agreement to air MyNetworkTV
programming and the merger of UPN and The WB into a network called The CW.&#160; Refer to <i>Item 1.</i>  <i>Markets and Stations</i> table for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Some of our television stations are
broadcasting a second digital signal as permitted by FCC rules.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Data</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

following table sets forth certain of our operating data from continuing
operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in
millions).&#160; For definitions of terms, see
the footnotes to the table in <i>Item 6.
Selected Financial Data</i>.</font></p>

  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="33%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:33.92%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total net broadcast revenues</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.8%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.68%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">622.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.68%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">627.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.68%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">606.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenues of $14.5 million, $4.7 million
and $3.4 million in 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively, generated from our
retransmission consent agreements are categorized as local/regional advertising
pursuant to EITF 00-21.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Political revenue is not comparable from
year to year due to the cyclicality of elections.&#160; See <i>Political Revenues</i>
below for more information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
largest categories of advertising and their approximate percentages of 2007 net
time sales were automotive (21.2%), professional services (14.6%), schools
(6.9%), paid programming (6.6%), fast food (6.4%) and retail (5.6%).&#160; No other advertising category accounted for
more than 5.0% of our net time sales in 2007.&#160;
Along with the industry, we have seen softness in the automotive
advertising category.&#160; We conduct
business with thousands of advertisers.&#160;
No advertiser accounted for more than 1.25% of our consolidated
broadcast revenue in 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bo.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Net
Broadcast Revenues</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; From a revenue category standpoint, the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, when compared to 2006, was impacted by a decrease
in advertising revenues from political, retail, fast food, paid programming,
movies and soft drinks, offset by increases in medical, media, telecommunications,
services, cosmetics and home products.&#160;
Automotive, our single largest category, representing 21.2% of the year&#146;s
net time sales, was down 4.6%.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Political Revenues.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Local and national political revenues
were the primary drivers of higher revenue in 2006, compared to 2007 and 2005
because 2006 was an election year.&#160; For
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, political revenues decreased by $26.1
million to $5.0 million when compared to the same period in 2006.&#160; We expect political revenues to increase in
2008 from 2007 levels, because 2008 is a presidential election year.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Local Revenues</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Our revenues
from local advertisers, excluding political revenues, increased during the last
three years.&#160; We continue to focus on
increasing local advertising revenues through innovative sales and marketing
strategies in our markets.&#160; We continue
to provide an enhanced sales training course for all of our salespeople with a
focus on local revenue sales.&#160; We expect
to continue these efforts in 2008.&#160; Local
revenues excluding political increased $9.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, compared to the same period in 2006.&#160;
This increase was primarily due to revenue from our FOX affiliates which
were up $12.9 million in 2007, a 9.3% increase from 2006 offset by a decrease
in revenue from our MyNetworkTV affiliates of $5.1 million in 2007, a 6.5%
decrease from 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">National Revenues.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our revenues from national advertisers,
excluding political revenues, have continued to trend downward over time.&#160; We believe this trend represents a shift in
the way national advertising dollars are being spent and we believe this trend
will continue in the future.&#160; Advertisers
in major categories like automotive, soft drink and packaged goods have shifted
significant portions of their advertising budgets away from spot television
into non-traditional media, in-store promotions and product placement in
network shows<font style="background:white;">.&#160;
Automotive decreases are due to automotive companies reducing
advertising budgets and shifting advertising dollars to specific Direct
Marketing Areas.&#160; We had decreases in
national revenues, excluding political of $9.0 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, when compared to the same period in 2006.&#160;
More specifically in 2007, the primary drivers to our decrease in national
revenues were caused by a change in Super Bowl programming advertising revenues
were $2.0 million less than the same period in 2006 due to the shift in network
affiliation that aired the Super Bowl from ABC to CBS and weakness from our
MyNetworkTV stations.</font></font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Revenues.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our other revenues consist primarily of
revenues from retransmission consent agreements with multi-channel video
programming distributors, network compensation, production revenues and
revenues from our outsourcing agreements. &#160;Our retransmission consent agreements,
including the advertising component, generated $58.9 million in total broadcast
revenues during 2007 compared with $25.1 million in 2006 and $18.5 million in
2005.&#160; This growth trend is the result of
our ability to monetize our existing relationships as cable providers struggle
with increased competition from alternative video delivery providers and have
begun to recognize the value of our digital and high definition signals and
network programming.&#160; Pursuant to EITF 00-21,
during 2007, $44.4 million of the total $58.9 million in revenues generated
from our retransmission consent agreements are included in other revenues while
the remaining $14.5 million is included in net time sales.&#160; During 2006, $20.4 million of the total $25.1
million in revenues generated from our retransmission consent agreements are
included in other revenues while the remaining $4.7 million is included in net
time sales.&#160; During 2005, $15.1 million
of the total $18.5 million in revenues generated from our retransmission
consent agreements are included in other revenues while the remaining $3.4
million is included in net time sales.&#160;
Certain agreements are set to expire in 2008 and therefore, contractual
negotiations are expected.&#160; We expect to
continue to generate revenues from retransmission consent agreements at terms
as favorable as or more favorable than our existing agreements upon the
expiration of those agreements.&#160; Our
retransmission consent agreements include automatic annual fee escalators.&#160; Network compensation decreased by $2.9
million during 2007 and $3.8 million during 2006.&#160; We expect further decreases in revenues from
network compensation in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Expense
and Other Income Discussion and Analysis</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table presents our significant expense and other income categories
for the three years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="35%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:35.42%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.42%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2005</font></b></p>
