  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.84%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="35%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:35.42%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment of
  intangibles</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.14%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.44%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(100.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.84%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="35%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:35.42%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income tax
  provision</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.14%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.44%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">184.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(81.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.84%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Station
production expenses.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station production expenses for 2007
increased compared to 2006 as a result of increases in programming expenses of
$1.7 million, engineering expenses of $1.0 million, production expenses of $0.7
million, news expenses of $0.6 million, promotion expenses of $0.5 million,
rating service fees of $0.5 million and music license fees of $0.2
million.&#160; These increases were offset by
decreases in costs related to LMAs and outsourcing agreements of $0.6 million
and other miscellaneous expenses of $0.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station production
expenses for 2006 decreased compared to 2005 as a result of decreases in news
expenses of $3.8 million related to the shutdown of News Central at several
stations, rating service fees of $1.5 million and programming expenses of $1.7
million.&#160; These decreases were offset by
increases in costs related to LMAs and outsourcing agreements of $0.3 million,
engineering expenses of $0.7 million, music license fees of $0.7 million,
promotion expenses of $0.2 million, production expenses of $0.2 million and
other expenses of $0.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;Station selling, general and administrative
expenses.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station selling, general and
administrative expenses for 2007 increased compared to the same period in 2006
as a result of increases in sales expenses of $1.3 million, national
representative commissions costs of $0.6 million and other general and
administrative expenses primarily related to health care costs of $0.4 million,
salary and bonus increases of $0.4 million, electric expense of $0.2 million
and other expenses of $0.2 million offset by decreases in personal property
taxes of $0.8 million and non-income based taxes of $0.3 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station selling, general and administrative expenses
for 2006 increased compared to the same period in 2005 as a result of increases
in general and administrative expenses primarily related to salary and bonus
increases of $1.1 million, bad debt expense of $0.7 million, audit and
accounting fees of $0.4 million and insurance, utilities and other net costs of
$1.3 million.&#160; In addition, there was an
increase in national representative commissions costs of $0.1 million.&#160; These increases were offset by decreases in
traffic expense of $1.4 million and sales expenses of $0.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We expect 2008 station
production and station selling, general and administrative expenses excluding
barter to be up from 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Amortization
of program contract costs.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The amortization of program contract
costs increased during 2007 compared to 2006 primarily due to an increase of
$6.7 million in write-downs of our program contract costs partially offset by a
decrease in program amortization of $0.9 million.&#160; The amortization increase during 2006
compared to 2005 was primarily due to significant program additions.&#160; We expect program contract amortization expense
to decrease in 2008 when compared to 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bq.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:46 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Depreciation
of property and equipment.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The depreciation of property and
equipment decreased in 2007 compared to 2006 and in 2006 compared to 2005. &#160;These decreases are primarily related to
assets becoming fully depreciated over time.&#160;
These decreases are offset by depreciation associated with capital
expenditures of $23.2 million, $16.9 million and $16.7 million in 2007, 2006
and 2005, respectively. &#160;We expect
depreciation on property and equipment to increase in 2008 when compared to
2007 and capital expenditures are expected to be greater in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Corporate
general and administrative expenses.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate general and administrative
expenses represent the costs to operate our corporate headquarters
location.&#160; Such costs include, among
other things, corporate departmental salaries, bonuses, fringe benefits and
other compensation, directors&#146; and officers&#146; life insurance, health and other
insurance, rent, telephone, consulting fees, legal, accounting, director fees
and strategic development initiatives.&#160;
Corporate departments include executive, treasury, finance and
accounting, human resources, technology, corporate relations, legal, sales,
engineering, operations and purchasing.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate general and
administrative expense for 2007 increased compared to the same period in 2006
due to increases in stock-based compensation expense for stock-settled stock
appreciation rights of $1.0 million, restricted and unrestricted stock awards
of $0.5 million, investment consulting fees of $0.5 million, the difference in
the amount of workers compensation insurance refunds received in 2006 compared
to 2007 amounting to $0.5 million, increases in compensation expense of $0.3
million, satellite costs of $0.2 million, property insurance of $0.2 million,
director&#146;s fees of $0.1 million and health care costs of $0.1 million.&#160; These increases were offset by decreases in
legal fees of $0.8 million, costs related to the shutdown of unprofitable local
news programming at several stations in 2006 of $0.7 million, building rent of
$0.2 million, and directors and officers insurance of $0.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate general and
administrative expense for 2006 increased compared to the same period in 2005
due to increases of $1.7 million related to the shutdown of News Central at
several stations and other strategic development initiatives related to news,
salary and bonus expense of $1.4 million, legal fees of $0.5 million,
restricted and unrestricted stock compensation costs of $0.1 million and other
miscellaneous expenses of $0.2 million.&#160;
These increases were offset by property and general insurance
reimbursements of $0.2 million, workers compensation refunds of $0.4 million,
decreases in health care costs of $1.0 million and audit and accounting fees of
$0.7 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
expect corporate overhead expenses to increase in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest
expense.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense presented in the financial statements
is related to continuing operations.&#160; Interest
expense has been decreasing since 2004, primarily due to refinancings we have
undertaken.&#160; The decrease during 2007
compared to 2006 is primarily due to the redemption of the 8.75% Senior
Subordinated Notes, due 2011 (the 8.75% Notes) on January&nbsp;22, 2007 and the
partial redemption of the 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2012 (the 8.0%
Notes) on June&nbsp;11, 2007 and June&nbsp;18, 2007.&#160; These decreases were partially offset by an
increase in interest on our Revolving Credit Facility and Term Loan and interest
on the 3.0% Convertible Senior Notes, due 2027.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense for 2006
decreased compared to the same period in 2005 due to the expiration of two
interest rate swap agreements, a decrease of interest related to derivative
instruments, and the repurchase of the 8.0% Notes.&#160; The decrease was offset by increases due to
the accretion of a debt discount as a result of the redemption of our Series&nbsp;D
Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock for Convertible Debentures in the
second quarter of 2005 and interest expense related to amended state income tax
returns.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We expect interest
expense to decrease in 2008 when compared to 2007, assuming no changes in the
current interest rate yield curve or changes in our assumption of debt levels
for 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Loss from
extinguishment of debt.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2007 and June&nbsp;2007,
we redeemed and partially redeemed our 8.75% Notes and our 8.0% Notes,
respectively.&#160; The redemption of the
8.75% Notes resulted in a $15.7 million loss from extinguishment of debt.&#160; The partial redemption of the 8.0% Notes
resulted in a $15.0 million loss from extinguishment of debt.&#160; For further information see <i>Liquidity and Capital Resources</i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gain from
derivative instruments.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We record gains and losses related to
certain of our derivative instruments not treated as hedges in accordance with
SFAS No.&nbsp;133, <i>Accounting for Derivative
Instruments and Hedging Activities,</i> as amended.&#160; The fair
value of our derivative instruments is primarily based on the anticipated
future interest rate curves at the end of each period.&#160; During 2006, certain instruments expired
resulting in a reduction in unrealized gain.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
(loss) from equity and cost method investments.&#160;
</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
2007, we recorded $1.6 million in income from certain private investment
funds.&#160; This income was offset by an
impairment of $1.0 million related to one of our direct investments in a
privately held small business.&#160; During
2006, we recorded $7.3 million of income from our investment in a private
investment fund.&#160; This was a result of
the sale and initial public offering of certain of the fund&#146;s portfolio
companies.&#160; This income was partially
offset by losses from one of our direct investments in a privately held small
business.&#160; The loss in 2005 primarily
related to the impairment of one of our direct investments in a privately held
small business.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bq.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:46 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gain on
insurance settlement. </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the first quarter of 2003, one of our towers in Charleston, West
Virginia collapsed during a severe ice storm.&#160;
In 2005, we recognized a gain on insurance settlement of $1.2 million
related to rebuilding the tower and replacing the other assets that were
destroyed by the collapse.<i>  </i>&#160;We did not receive any additional payments or
gains related to this claim in 2007 and 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Impairment
of intangibles.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On a periodic basis, we test our goodwill
for impairment in accordance with the applicable accounting rules.&#160; See <i>Note 5. Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets,</i> in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial
Statements.&#160; In 2006, we recorded an
impairment of $11.9 million related to goodwill.&#160; In addition, during 2006, we wrote-down a
decaying advertiser based definite-lived intangible asset by $3.7 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
tax provision</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We adopted the provisions of FASB
Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty
in Income Taxes</i> (FIN 48) on January&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; The adoption of FIN 48 did not cause a
material change to our contingent liability for unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; We decreased the January&nbsp;1, 2007 balance
of our accumulated deficit position by $0.6 million to apply the cumulative
effect of the FIN 48 adoption.&#160; As of the
date of adoption, we had $32.9 million of gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; Of this total, $17.6 million (net of federal
effect on state tax issues) and $7.8 million (net of federal effect on state
tax issues) represent the amounts of unrecognized tax benefits that, if
recognized, would favorably affect our effective tax rates from continuing
operations and discontinued operations, respectively.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had $28.0
million of gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160;
Of this total, $15.1 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues)
and $7.1 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues) represent the amounts
of unrecognized tax benefits that, if recognized, would favorably affect our
effective tax rates from continuing operations and discontinued operations,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recognize accrued
interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax
expense.&#160; We had $6.7 million and $0
accrued for interest and penalties, respectively, at January&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; We recognized $0.4 million of income tax
benefit for interest related to uncertain tax positions during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 2007 income tax
provision for our pre-tax income from continuing operations of $39.2 million
resulted in an effective tax rate of 47.9%.&#160;
The 2006 income tax provision for our pre-tax income from continuing
operations of $55.1 million resulted in an effective tax rate of 12.0%.&#160; The increase in effective tax rate from 2007
to 2006 is primarily attributable to the release of discrete tax and related
interest reserves during 2006 as a result of the expiration of the statute of
limitations for the federal income tax returns for 1999 through 2002.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had a net
deferred tax liability of $305.6 million as compared to a net deferred tax
liability of $274.0 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The increase primarily relates to an increase
in deferred tax liabilities associated with book and tax differences
attributable to the amortization of intangible assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 2006 income tax
provision for our pre-tax income from continuing operations of $55.1 million
resulted in an effective tax rate of 12.0%.&#160;
The 2005 income tax provision for our pre-tax income from continuing
operations of $70.5 million resulted in an effective tax rate of 51.1%.&#160; The decrease in effective tax rate from 2005
to 2006 is primarily attributable to the release of discrete tax and related
interest reserves as a result of the expiration of the statute of limitations
for the Federal income tax returns for 1999 through 2002.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, we had a net deferred tax liability of $274.0 million as compared to a
net deferred tax liability of $266.9 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; The increase in deferred taxes primarily
relates to a decrease in deferred tax assets associated with additional
valuation allowances recorded to reflect a change in circumstances causing a
change in judgment with respect to realizability of state net operating losses.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Operating Divisions&#146; Revenue and Expense</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table presents Other Operating Divisions&#146; revenue and expenses
related to G1440 Holdings,&nbsp;Inc. (G1440), our software development,
information technology staffing and consulting company, Acrodyne Communications,&nbsp;Inc.
(Acrodyne), a manufacturer of television transmissions systems and Triangle
Signs&nbsp;&amp; Services,&nbsp;Inc. (Triangle), a sign designer and fabricator,
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in millions):</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:16.26%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.5%;">

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Triangle was acquired in May&nbsp;2007.&#160; The decrease in Acrodyne&#146;s revenue for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to the same period in 2006 is due to
a decrease in market demand.&#160; Other
includes partial year results of other operating divisions&#146; companies acquired
during 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES</font></i></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our financial condition
and balance sheet continue to get stronger.&#160;
As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had $21.0 million in cash and cash
equivalent balances and working capital of approximately $13.4 million.&#160; Cash generated by our operations and
availability under our Revolver are used as our primary source of liquidity.&#160; We anticipate that in 2008, cash flow from
our operations and borrowings under the Revolver will be sufficient to continue
paying dividends under our current policy and to satisfy our debt service
obligations, capital expenditure requirements plans including those related to
the upgrade and expansion of stations&#146; high-definition master control systems
and certain strategic investment and working capital needs.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had borrowed
$95.0 million under our Term Loan A.&#160; Our
ability to draw on our Revolver is based on pro forma trailing cash flow levels
as defined in our Bank Credit Agreement.&#160;
For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, the entire $175.0 million of
current borrowing capacity was available under our Revolver.&#160; Our Term Loan A-1 was drawn in full on January&nbsp;16,
2007 in order to redeem the 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2011, which we
redeemed in full on January&nbsp;22, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;22, 2002,
we filed a $350.0 million universal shelf registration statement with the
Securities and Exchange Commission which will permit us to offer and sell various
types of securities from time to time.&#160;
Offered securities may include common stock, debt securities, preferred
stock, depository shares or any combination thereof in amounts, prices and on
terms to be announced when the securities are offered.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had $5.0
million of availability under our universal shelf registration statement filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission that expires on November&nbsp;30,
2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Sources and Uses of Cash</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth our cash flows for the
years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="60%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:60.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="60%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:60.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dividend paid on
  Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B Common Stock</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.66%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(19.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="60%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:60.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0.375pt .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0.375pt .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(12.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0.375pt .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="60%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:60.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.0%;">

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(136.3</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 1.5pt .7pt;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Activities</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows from operating activities were $9.1
million lower for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to the same
period in 2006.&#160; During 2007, we paid
$27.2 million more for the extinguishment of debt due to the full redemption of
the 8.75% Notes and the partial redemption of the 8.0% Notes.&#160; Additionally, we received $4.2 million less
in distributions from equity and cost method investees, $3.8 million less in
tax refunds and $1.4 million less in operating cash flows from stations we
sold.&#160; Offsetting these amounts, we paid
$11.8 million less in interest payments, $10.0 million less in program
payments, $4.5 million less in tax payments, and $1.2 million less in cash
receipts from customers, net of cash payments to vendors for operating expenses
and other working capital cash activities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows from operating activities were
$100.7 million higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to the
same period in 2005.&#160; During 2006, cash
receipts from customers, net of cash payments to vendors for operating expenses
and other working capital cash activities were $36.7 million higher compared to
the same period in 2005.&#160; Additionally,
we paid $16.0 million less in program payments, $10.7 million less in interest
payments, $33.4 million less in tax payments and received $11.3 million more in
tax refunds and $4.0 million more in distributions from equity and cost method
investees in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; These amounts were offset by $11.4 million in
operating cash flows from stations we sold.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We expect program payments to increase in 2008
compared to 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Investing Activities</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows used in investing activities
increased for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to the same period
in 2006.&#160; During the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, we paid $39.1 million, net of cash acquired related to our acquisitions
of Triangle Sign&nbsp;&amp; Service,&nbsp;Inc., FBP Holding Company, LLC, Bagby
Investors, LLC and Alarm Funding Associates, LLC.&#160; In addition, we made $16.2 million and $0.8
million in equity and debt investments, respectively, in real estate
ventures.&#160; These acquisitions and
investments reflect our strategy to maximize value for our shareholders, which
includes diversification through investments in non&#150;television assets.&#160; We had an increase in capital expenditures of
$6.3 million.&#160; These outflows were
partially offset by an increase of $19.6 million related to the sale of certain
broadcasting assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">45</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='45',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bq.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:46 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows from investing activities were also
significantly different for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to
the same period in 2005 primarily because of proceeds from the sale of
television stations, offset by cash paid for the acquisition of stations in
2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For 2008, we anticipate
incurring an increase of capital expenditures when compared to 2007 for our
upgrade to high-definition master control systems, build out of high definition
news, station maintenance, equipment replacement and consolidation of building
and tower needs in some markets.&#160; We
expect to fund such capital expenditures with cash generated from operating
activities and borrowings under our Revolver.&#160;
In addition, when the opportunity is available to us and it makes
economic sense, we may accelerate the timing of capital expenditures from 2009
to 2008 in order to take advantage of recently passed favorable tax legislation
related to the recent economic stimulus legislation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financing Activities</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
cash flows used in financing activities increased for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 compared to the same period in 2006.&#160;
Our debt repayments to non-affiliates, net of debt issuances, in 2007
was $89.0 million compared to $39.4 million in 2006.&#160; In addition, we increased the value returned
to our shareholders through dividend payments on our common stock that were
$13.4 million higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to the
same period in 2006 due to multiple dividend rate increases.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
cash flows from financing activities were significantly different for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to the same period in 2005 because we
utilized the cash from the sale of television stations to repay debt during
2005.&#160; Our debt repayments to
non-affiliates, net of debt issuances, in 2006 was $39.4 million compared to
$308.4 million in 2005.&#160; Dividend
payments on our common stock were $16.9 million higher for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 compared to the same period in 2005 because our dividend rate increased.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;6, 2008, we announced that our
Board of Directors approved an increase to our annual dividend to 80 cents per
share from 70 cents per share.&#160; We intend
to declare dividend distributions each future quarter.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The dividends paid for 2007, 2006 and 2005 are shown
below:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.96%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$13.1 million</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.48%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.96%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.5%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
2007, we repurchased face values of $307.4 million and $354.9 million of our
8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2011 and 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes,
due 2012 (the 8.0% Notes), respectively.&#160;
During January&nbsp;2008, we repurchased, in the open market, $6.9
million face value of the 8.0% Notes.&#160;
From time to time, we may repurchase additional outstanding debt on the
open market.&#160; We expect to fund any
repurchases with cash generated from operating activities and borrowings under
our Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;5,
2008, our Board of Directors renewed its authorization to repurchase up to
$150.0 million of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on the open market or through
private transactions.&#160; We did not
repurchase any Class&nbsp;A Common Stock during 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\JMS\jbelang\08-2529-1\task2742399\2529-1-bq.htm',USER='jbelang',CD='Feb 29 09:46 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Seasonality/Cyclicality</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are
usually subject to seasonal fluctuations.&#160;
Usually, the second and fourth quarter operating results are higher than
the first and third quarters because advertising expenditures are increased in
anticipation of certain seasonal and holiday spending by consumers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
operating results are usually subject to fluctuations from political
advertising.&#160; In even numbered years,
political spending is usually significantly higher than in odd numbered years
due to advertising expenditures preceding local and national elections.&#160; Additionally, every four years, political
spending is elevated further due to advertising expenditures preceding the
presidential election.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Contractual Obligations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have various contractual obligations which are recorded as liabilities in our
consolidated financial statements.&#160; Other
items, such as certain purchase commitments and other executory contracts are
not recognized as liabilities in our consolidated financial statements but are
required to be disclosed.&#160; For example,
we are contractually committed to acquire future programming and make certain
minimum lease payments for the use of property under operating lease
agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table reflects a summary of our contractual cash obligations as of December&nbsp;31,
2007 and the future periods in which such obligations are expected to be
settled in cash (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
RELATED TO CONTINUING OPERATIONS </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">(a</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:44.84%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.3%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Total</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.32%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.58%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2008</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">

  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2009-2010</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.26%;">

</table>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Excluded from this table are $28.0
million of accrued unrecognized tax benefits.&#160;
Due to inherent uncertainty, we can not make reasonable estimates of the
amount and period payments will be made.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes a one-year estimate of $4.9
million in payments related to contracts that automatically renew.&#160; We have not calculated potential payments for
years after 2013.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes interest on fixed rate debt and
capital leases.&#160; Estimated interest on
our recourse variable rate debt has been excluded.&#160; Recourse variable rate debt represents $320.0
million of our $1.3 billion total face value of debt as of December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future film liabilities reflect a license
agreement for program material that is not yet available for its first showing
or telecast and is, therefore, not recorded as an asset or liability on our
balance sheet.&#160; Pursuant to SFAS No.&nbsp;63,
<i>Financial Reporting for Broadcasters</i>,
an asset and a liability for the rights acquired and obligations incurred under
a license agreement are reported on the balance sheet when the cost of each
program is known or reasonably determinable, the program material has been
accepted by the licensee in accordance with the conditions of the license
agreement and the program is available for its first showing or telecast.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each future periods&#146; film liability
includes contractual amounts owed, however, what is contractually owed doesn&#146;t
necessarily reflect what we are expected to pay during that period.&#160; While we are legally contractually bound to
make the payments reflected in the table during the indicated periods, industry
protocol typically enables us to make film payments on a three-month lag.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes obligations related to rating
service fees, music license fees, market research, weather and news services.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='47',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2740791\2529-1-bs.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 00:34 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Off Balance
Sheet Arrangements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Off
balance sheet arrangements as defined by the SEC include the following four
items:&#160; obligations under certain guarantees
or contracts; retained or contingent interest in assets transferred to an
unconsolidated entity or similar arrangements; obligations under certain
derivative arrangements; and obligations arising out of a material variable
interest in an unconsolidated entity.&#160; We
have entered into arrangements where we have obligations under certain
guarantees or contracts because we believe they will help improve shareholder
returns.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;26,
2005, we entered into a twelve-month limited scope liquidity assurance with
Acrodyne Communications,&nbsp;Inc. (Acrodyne), one of our majority-owned
subsidiaries.&#160; On July&nbsp;14, 2006, we
extended the liquidity assurance for an additional twelve-month period.&#160; Pursuant to this agreement, we provided to
them sufficient funding to cover any necessary working capital needs through May&nbsp;25,
2007, when Acrodyne could not provide that funding on its own.&#160; In connection with this liquidity assurance,
we established a $0.5 million line of credit for Acrodyne.&#160; Interest on any unpaid indebtedness is
calculated on a daily basis at LIBOR plus 225 basis points per annum.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, Acrodyne had
borrowed $0.5 million under this line of credit.&#160; The liquidity assurance was not extended in
2007.&#160; We provide no liquidity assurance
to any of our other operating division companies or real estate venture
investment entities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table reflects a summary of these off balance sheet arrangements, as
defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), as of December&nbsp;31,
2007 and the future periods in which such arrangements may be settled in cash
if certain contingent events occur (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.96%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.96%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="45%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:45.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">LMA and outsourcing agreements (c)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.56%;">

  </td>

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,998</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">280</font></p>
