<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-9',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ca.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:12 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SINCLAIR BROADCAST GROUP, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>NATURE OF
OPERATIONS AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature of Operations</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair
Broadcast Group,&nbsp;Inc. is a diversified television broadcasting company
that owns or provides certain programming, operating or sales services to
television stations pursuant to broadcasting licenses that are granted by the
Federal Communications Commission.&#160; We
currently own, provide programming and operating services pursuant to local
marketing agreements (LMAs) or provide, or are provided, sales services
pursuant to outsourcing agreements to 58 television stations in 35
markets.&#160; For the purpose of this report,
these 58 stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148; stations.&#160; Our broadcast group is a single reportable
segment for accounting purposes and includes diverse network affiliations as
follows: FOX (20 stations); MyNetworkTV (17 stations); ABC (9 stations); The CW
(9 stations); CBS (2 stations) and NBC (1 station).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principles of Consolidation</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
consolidated financial statements include our accounts and those of our
wholly-owned and majority-owned subsidiaries and variable interest entities for
which we are the primary beneficiary.&#160;
Minority interest represents a minority owner&#146;s proportionate share of
the equity in certain of our consolidated entities.&#160; All significant intercompany transactions and
account balances have been eliminated in consolidation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Discontinued Operations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with
Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS) No.&nbsp;144, <i>Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</i>,
we have reported the financial position and results of operations of KOVR-TV in
Sacramento, California, KSMO-TV in Kansas City, Missouri, WEMT-TV in
Tri-Cities, Tennessee and WGGB-TV in Springfield, Massachusetts as assets and
liabilities held for sale in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets and
consolidated statements of operations.&#160;
Discontinued operations have not been segregated in the consolidated
statements of cash flows and, therefore, amounts for certain captions will not
agree with the accompanying consolidated balance sheets and consolidated
statements of operations.&#160; The operating
results of KOVR-TV, KSMO-TV, WEMT-TV and WGGB-TV are not included in our
consolidated results from continuing operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005.&#160; In accordance with
Emerging Issues Task Force Issue No.&nbsp;87-24, <i>Allocation
of Interest to Discontinued Operations</i>, we have allocated $3.6
million of interest expense to discontinued operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160;&#160; No interest expense was allocated
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.&#160; See <i>Note 13.</i>  <i>Discontinued Operations,</i> for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Variable Interest
Entities</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2003, the FASB issued Interpretation No.&nbsp;46
(revised December&nbsp;2003), <i>Consolidation
of Variable Interest Entities, an Interpretation of Accounting Research
Bulletin No.&nbsp;51</i> (FIN 46R).&#160;
FIN 46R introduces the variable interest entity consolidation model,
which determines control and consolidation based on potential variability in
gains and losses of the entity being evaluated for consolidation.&#160; We adopted FIN 46R on March&nbsp;31,
2004.&#160; We consolidate Variable Interest
Entities (VIEs) when we are the primary beneficiary.&#160; All debt held by our VIEs is non-recourse to
us.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our application to acquire the FCC license of WNAB-TV
in Nashville, Tennessee is pending FCC approval.&#160; As a result, we have an outsourcing agreement
with WNAB-TV to provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and
administrative services to WNAB-TV.&#160; The
outsourcing agreement is considered a variable interest in WNAB-TV.&#160; We have determined that the WNAB-TV license
asset entity is a VIE and that we are the primary beneficiary of variable
interests.&#160; As a result, we consolidate
the assets and liabilities of WNAB-TV.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our applications to acquire the FCC licenses of all
the television stations owned by Cunningham Broadcasting Corporation
(Cunningham) are pending FCC approval.&#160;
We have a LMA agreement with each of the television stations that are
considered variable interests.&#160; We have
determined that the Cunningham license asset entities are VIEs and that we are
the primary beneficiary of variable interests.&#160;
As a result, we consolidate the assets and liabilities of Cunningham.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-10</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-10',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ca.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:12 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2007, we made investments in two real estate
ventures considered to be VIEs.&#160; We have
determined that we are the primary beneficiary of variable interests in these
entities; as a result we consolidate the assets and liabilities of these entities.&#160; The activities of the real estate ventures
are not material to our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2008, we entered into an agreement with an
unrelated third party for the right to acquire the licensed assets of KFXA-TV
in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, pending FCC approval, for $1.9 million.&#160; We have determined the KFXA-TV license asset
entity is a VIE and that we are the primary beneficiary of variable interests
of KFXA-TV as a result of the terms of our outsourcing agreement and purchase
option.&#160; As a result, we will consolidate
the assets and liabilities of KFXA-TV in the first quarter 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Use of Estimates</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
preparation of financial statements in accordance with accounting principles
generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets,
liabilities, revenues and expenses in the consolidated financial statements and
in the disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities.&#160; Actual results could differ from those
estimates.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquisitions</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2007, we
acquired Triangle Sign&nbsp;&amp; Service,&nbsp;Inc. (Triangle), a
Baltimore-based company whose primary business is to design and fabricate
commercial signs for retailers, sports complexes and other commercial businesses,
for $15.9 million, net of cash acquired.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2007, we
acquired FBP Holding Company, LLC (FBP Holding), which holds an investment in a
commercial warehouse property located in Baltimore, Maryland, for $8.3 million,
consisting of $1.2 million cash, net of cash acquired, and $7.1 million in the
assumption of debt.&#160; Debt assumed in
conjunction with this acquisition is non-recourse to us.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2007,
we acquired Bagby Investors, LLC (Bagby), which holds an investment in a
commercial office building in Baltimore, Maryland, for $16.9 million, net of
cash acquired.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2007,
we acquired Alarm Funding Associates, LLC (Alarm Funding), which is a regional
security alarm operating and bulk acquisition company located in Exton,
Pennsylvania for $4.9 million, net of cash acquired.&#160; We expect to finalize the purchase price
allocation for Alarm Funding in first quarter 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We consolidate the
financial statements of these entities.&#160;
Their results are included in the financial statements from the date of
their acquisition.&#160; These acquisitions
are not material to our consolidated financial statements.&#160; These acquisitions are shown in the statement
of cash flows as payments for acquisitions of other operating divisions&#146;
companies.&#160; We entered into these
acquisitions as part of our strategy to maximize value for our shareholders,
which includes diversification through investments in non-television assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2008,
we acquired the non-licensed assets of KFXA-TV in Cedar Rapids, Iowa for $17.1
million in cash and the right to purchase licensed assets, pending FCC
approval, for $1.9 million.&#160; Our CBS
affiliate in Cedar Rapids, KGAN-TV, will provide sales and other
non-programming related services to KFXA-TV pursuant to a joint sales agreement.&#160; We will consolidate the financial statements
of the non-licensed and licensed assets of KFXA-TV in first quarter 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investments</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use the equity
method of accounting for investments in which we have between 20% and 50%
ownership interest or when we have significant influence over the operations of
the business.&#160; For investments in which
we have more than 50% ownership interest, we consolidate the operations; and
for investments in which we have less than 20% ownership interest, we use the
lower of cost or fair market value method of accounting.&#160; See <i>Note 3. Investments,</i>
for more information regarding our investments.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2007, we
made $17.0 million in cash investments in various real estate ventures
including developmental land and apartment and shopping complexes.&#160; All of these investments were accounted for
under the equity method of accounting.&#160;
In first quarter 2008, we made an add-on cash investment of $4.5 million
primarily in developmental land and a $3.0 million cash investment in Patriot
Capital II, LP (Patriot Capital).&#160;
Patriot Capital provides structured debt and mezzanine financing to
small businesses.&#160; After the initial $3.0
million investment, our remaining unfunded commitment to Patriot Capital is
$17.0 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-11</font></p>

<div align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-11',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ca.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:12 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent Accounting
Pronouncements</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007,
the Financial Standards Accounting Board (FASB) issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;159, <i>The Fair Value Option for
Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities&#151;Including an amendment of FASB
Statement No.&nbsp;115</i> (SFAS 159).&#160;
The fair value option established by this Statement permits all entities
to choose to measure eligible items at fair value at specified election
dates.&#160; Unrealized gains and losses on
items for which the fair value option has been elected are to be reported in
earnings at each subsequent reporting date.&#160;
This Statement is effective for our fiscal year beginning January&nbsp;1,
2008.&#160; We currently have no plans to
apply the option provisions of SFAS 159 to our consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued FASB Staff Position (FSP) FIN 48-1, <i>Definition
of &#145;Settlement&#146;</i>  <i>in FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48</i>.&#160; This FSP amends FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48,
<i>Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes </i>(FIN
48), to provide guidance on how an enterprise should determine whether a tax
position is effectively settled for the purpose of recognizing previously
unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; The guidance
in this FSP should be applied by companies upon the initial adoption of FIN
48.&#160; We adopted FIN 48 in 2007, see <i>Note 10. Income Taxes </i>for more information.&#160; This FSP and FIN 48 did not have a material
impact on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2007, the
Emerging Issues Task Force (EITF) issued the consensus on Issue No.&nbsp;06-11,
<i>Accounting for Income Tax Benefits of Dividends on
Share-Based Payment Awards</i>.&#160;
The provisions require companies to recognize the tax benefits of
dividends on unvested share-based payments in equity and reclassify the tax
benefits from additional paid-in capital to the income statement when the
related award is forfeited.&#160; The
provisions are effective prospectively starting January&nbsp;1, 2008.&#160; The impact of this issue will not have a
material effect to our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued FSP, APB 14-a, an interpretation of APB Opinion No.&nbsp;14, <i>Accounting for Convertible Debt and Debt Issued with Stock Purchase
Warrants</i>.&#160; This proposed FSP
provides clarification on the accounting for convertible debt instruments that
may be settled in cash upon conversion, including partial cash settlement.&#160; If issued, the guidance could significantly
impact the accounting for instruments commonly referred to as Instrument C,
which is structured so that upon conversion, the principal amount of the
obligation is paid in cash and the conversion spread is settled in cash or
shares.&#160; This proposed FSP would require
the issuer to bifurcate a component of the debt and classify that component in
shareholder&#146;s equity, then accrete the resulting discount on the debt resulting
in interest expense equal to the issuer&#146;s nonconvertible debt borrowing
rate.&#160; The expected effective date is for
fiscal years beginning after January&nbsp;1, 2009 and is required to be retroactively
applied.&#160; Such a change in the accounting
for convertible debt securities could have a material impact on our
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued FSP FAS 142-f, <i>Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets</i>.&#160; This
proposed FSP amends the factors that should be considered in developing renewal
or extension assumptions used to determine the useful life of an intangible
asset under FASB Statement No.&nbsp;142, <i>Goodwill and Other
Intangibles </i>(FAS 142).&#160; The
FSP aims to improve the consistency between the useful life of an intangible
asset as determined under FAS 142 and the period of expected cash flows used to
measure the fair value of the asset under FASB Statement No.&nbsp;141, <i>Business Combinations</i>, and other applicable accounting literature.&#160; As a result of this FSP, entities generally
will be able to align the assumptions used for valuing an intangible asset with
those used to determine its useful life. This FSP will be effective for
financial statements issued for fiscal years beginning after June&nbsp;15, 2008
and interim periods within those fiscal years.&#160;
We are currently evaluating the effect of this statement on our
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No 141 (revised
2007), <i>Business Combinations</i> (FAS 141(R)).&#160; FAS 141(R)&nbsp;requires an acquiring entity
to recognize all the assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a transaction
at the acquisition-date fair value with limited exceptions.&#160; In addition to new disclosure requirements,
FAS 141(R)&nbsp;also makes the following significant changes: acquisition costs
are expensed as incurred, noncontrolling interests are valued at fair value at
the acquisition date, acquired contingencies are recorded at fair value at the
acquisition date and subsequently re-measured at either the higher of such
amount or the amount determined under existing guidance for non-acquired
contingencies, in-process research and development costs are recorded at fair
value as an indefinite-lived intangible asset at the acquisition date,
restructuring costs are expensed subsequent to the acquisition date and changes
in deferred tax asset valuation allowances and income tax uncertainties after
the acquisition date generally affect income tax expense.&#160; This statement is effective for business
combinations in which the acquisition date is on or after the beginning of the
first annual reporting period beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008 and
early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We are
currently evaluating the effect of this statement on our consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp; 160, <i>Noncontrolling Interests in Consolidated Financial Statements, an
Amendment of ARB No.&nbsp;51 </i>(FAS 160). &#160;This statement requires the recognition of a
noncontrolling interest (minority interest) as equity in the consolidated
financial statements and separate from the parent&#146;s equity.&#160; The amount of net income attributable to the
noncontrolling interest will be included in consolidated net income on the face
of the income statement.&#160; Changes in a
parent&#146;s ownership interest that result in deconsolidation of a subsidiary will
result in the recognition of a gain or loss in net income when the subsidiary
is deconsolidated.&#160; FAS 160 also includes
expanded disclosure </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-12</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-12',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ca.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:12 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">requirements regarding
the interests of the parent and its noncontrolling interest.&#160; The statement is effective for fiscals years,
and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning on or after December&nbsp;15,
2008.&#160; We are currently evaluating the
effect of this statement on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2008, the FASB issued FSP FAS 157-1
and FSP FAS 157-2, <i>Fair Value Measurements</i>.&#160; FSP FAS 157-1 amends FASB Statement No.&nbsp;157,
<i>Fair Value Measurements </i>(FAS 157) to
exclude FASB Statement No.&nbsp;13, <i>Accounting for Leases</i>
(FAS 13), and its related interpretive accounting pronouncements that address
leasing transactions.&#160; The FASB decided
to exclude leasing transactions covered by FAS 13 (except those arising from a
business combination) in order to allow it to more broadly consider the use of
fair value measurements for these transactions as part of its project to
comprehensively reconsider the accounting for leasing transactions.&#160; FAS 157-2 delays the effective date of FAS
157 for all non-financial assets and non-financial liabilities, except those
that are recognized or disclosed at fair value in the financial statements on a
recurring basis.&#160;&#160; The FSP states that
the application of FAS 157 for non-financial assets and non-financial
liabilities will be delayed until fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15,
2008 and interim periods within those fiscal years.&#160; FAS 157 was issued in September&nbsp;2006 and
defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value and
expands disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160; This standard is effective for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; The application
of FAS 157 will not have a material impact on our consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">SAB No.&nbsp;108</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
adopted Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB) 108, <i>Considering
the Effects of Prior Year Misstatements When Quantifying Misstatements in
Current Year Financial Statements </i>(SAB 108), during 2006 and
recorded a cumulative effect adjustment of $0.2 million (net of income taxes of
$6.0 million), to increase retained earnings as of January&nbsp;1, 2006.&#160; The adjustment was comprised of the following
components (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.08%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:68.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Tax effects attributable to above adjustments at our
  applicable effective tax rates</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:68.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:68.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Decrease in provision for income taxes resulting
  from the over-accrual of tax reserves and balance sheet book to tax basis
  differences</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2001-2005</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:68.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net impact on January&nbsp;1, 2006 retained earnings</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under
the rollover method of evaluating misstatements, we previously concluded that
the misstatements noted above were immaterial to all prior years&#146; results.&#160; The misstatements under the iron curtain
method described in SAB 108, as well as, the provisions of SAB 99, were
material to 2006 results, and therefore, were reflected as a cumulative effect
adjustment to retained earnings as of January&nbsp;1, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash and Cash
Equivalents</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We consider all highly liquid investments with an
original maturity of three months or less when purchased to be cash
equivalents.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Accounts
Receivable</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management regularly reviews accounts receivable and
determines an appropriate estimate for the allowance for doubtful accounts
based upon the impact of economic conditions on the merchant&#146;s ability to pay,
past collection experience and such other factors which, in management&#146;s
judgment, deserve current recognition.&#160;
In turn, a provision is charged against earnings in order to maintain
the appropriate allowance level.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-13</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-13',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ca.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:12 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Programming</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have agreements with distributors for the rights to
television programming over contract periods, which generally run from one to
seven years.&#160; Contract payments are made
in installments over terms that are generally equal to or shorter than the
contract period.&#160; Each contract is
recorded as an asset and a liability at an amount equal to its gross
contractual cash commitment when the license period begins and the program is
available for its first showing.&#160; The
portion of program contracts which becomes payable within one year is reflected
as a current liability in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The rights to this programming are reflected in the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets at the lower of unamortized cost or
estimated net realizable value.&#160;
Estimated net realizable values are based on management&#146;s expectation of
future advertising revenues, net of sales commissions, to be generated by the
program material.&#160; Amortization of
program contract costs is generally computed using either a four-year
accelerated method or based on usage, whichever method results in the most
amortization for each program.&#160; Program
contract costs estimated by management to be amortized in the succeeding year
are classified as current assets. &#160;Payments of program contract liabilities are
typically made on a scheduled basis and are not affected by adjustments for
amortization or estimated net realizable value.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Barter
Arrangements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain program contracts provide for the exchange of
advertising airtime in lieu of cash payments for the rights to such
programming.&#160; The revenues realized from
station barter arrangements are recorded as the programs are aired at the
estimated fair value of the advertising airtime given in exchange for the
program rights.&#160; Network programming is
excluded from these calculations.&#160;
Revenues are recorded as revenues realized from station barter
arrangements and the corresponding expenses are recorded as expenses recognized
from station barter arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We broadcast certain customers&#146; advertising in
exchange for equipment, merchandise and services.&#160; The estimated fair value of the equipment,
merchandise or services received is recorded as deferred barter costs and the
corresponding obligation to broadcast advertising is recorded as deferred
barter revenues.&#160; The deferred barter
costs are expensed or capitalized as they are used, consumed or received and
are included in station production expenses and station selling, general and
administrative expenses, as applicable.&#160;
Deferred barter revenues are recognized as the related advertising is
aired and are recorded in revenues realized from station barter arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006
consisted of the following (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="73%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:73.3%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.22%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During February&nbsp;2008, the counterparty to these
derivative instruments terminated the agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impairment of
Long-lived Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;144, <i>Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of
Long-Lived Assets</i> (SFAS 144), we periodically evaluate our
long-lived assets for impairment and will continue to evaluate them as events
or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of such assets
may not be fully recoverable.&#160; We evaluate
the recoverability of long-lived assets by measuring the carrying amount of the
assets against the estimated undiscounted future cash flows associated with
them.&#160; At the time that such evaluations
indicate that the future undiscounted cash flows of certain long-lived assets
are not sufficient to recover the carrying value of such assets, the assets are
tested for impairment by comparing their fair value to the carrying value.&#160; We typically estimate fair value using
discounted cash flow models and appraisals.&#160;
There was no impairment charge recorded for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, we recorded a $3.7 million impairment charge in our consolidated
statement of operations.&#160; See <i>Note 5. Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</i>, for more
information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not accrue for repair and maintenance activities
in advance of planned or unplanned major maintenance activities.&#160; We generally expense these activities when
incurred.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities based
on the differences between the financial statement&#146;s carrying amounts and the
tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160; We
provide a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets relating to various
federal and state net operating losses (NOLs) that are carried forward.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, valuation
allowances have been provided for a substantial amount of our available federal
and state NOLs.&#160; We evaluate the need and
extent of a valuation allowance based on the expected timing of the reversals
of existing temporary book/tax differences, alternative tax strategies and
projected future taxable income.&#160; If we
are unable to generate sufficient taxable income, or if there is a material
change in our projected taxable income, or if there is a change in our ability
to use NOL carryforwards due to changes in federal and state laws, we will make
any necessary adjustments to the valuation allowance.&#160; Management periodically performs a
comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax
contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews,
the status of ongoing audits and the expiration of applicable statute of
limitations, accruals are adjusted as necessary in accordance with the
recognition provisions of FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting
for Uncertainty in Income Taxes</i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Supplemental
Information &#151; Statements of Cash Flows</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

transactions (in thousands):</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:7.94%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">157</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.06%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-cash barter and trade expense are presented in the
consolidated statements of operations.&#160;
Non-cash transactions related to capital lease obligations were $8.9
million, $3.3 million and $1.0 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Debt
assumed in conjunction with the acquisition of other operating divisions&#146;
companies is non-recourse to us.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
