<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-15',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cc.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:17 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Local Marketing
Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We generally enter into local marketing agreements
(LMAs) and similar arrangements with stations located in markets in which we
already own and operate a station.&#160; Under
the terms of these agreements, we make specified periodic payments to the
owner-operator in exchange for the right to program and sell advertising on a
specific portion of the station&#146;s inventory of broadcast time.&#160; Nevertheless, as the holder of the FCC
license, the owner-operator retains control and responsibility for the
operation of the station, including responsibility over all programming content
broadcast on the station.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in the accompanying consolidated statements
of operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 are net
revenues of $109.3 million, $120.0 million and $118.6 million, respectively,
that relate to LMAs.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Outsourcing
Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into outsourcing agreements in which
our stations provide, or are provided, various non-programming related services
such as sales, operational and managerial services to, or by, other stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue
Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total revenues include: (i)&nbsp;cash and barter
advertising revenues, net of agency and national representatives&#146; commissions; (ii)&nbsp;retransmission
consent fees; (iii)&nbsp;network compensation; (iv)&nbsp;other broadcast
revenues and (v)&nbsp;revenues from our other operating divisions.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising revenues, net of agency and national
representatives&#146; commissions, are recognized in the period during which time
spots are aired.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
retransmission consent agreements contain both advertising and retransmission
consent elements.&#160; We have determined
that our retransmission consent agreements are revenue arrangements with
multiple deliverables and fall within the scope of EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-21, <i>Revenue Arrangements with Multiple Deliverables</i> (EITF
00-21).&#160; Advertising and retransmission
consent deliverables sold under our agreements are separated into different
units of accounting at fair value.&#160;&#160;
Revenue applicable to the advertising element of the arrangement is
recognized similar to the advertising revenue policy noted above.&#160; Revenue applicable to the retransmission
consent element of the arrangement is recognized ratably over the life of the
agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Network
compensation revenue is recognized ratably over the term of the contract.&#160; All other significant revenues are recognized
as services are provided.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Network Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;24, 2006,
CBS Corporation (CBS) and Warner Bros. Entertainment (Warner Bros.) announced
their intent to merge the operations of their respective networks, UPN and The
WB, under a broadcasting network called The CW.&#160;
On August&nbsp;1, 2004, we entered into an affiliation agreement with
UPN (for six stations) that was set to expire July&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; The agreement was for the networks to produce
and distribute programming in exchange for each station&#146;s commitment to air the
programming at specified times and for commercial announcement time during
programming.&#160; Under this agreement, UPN
was to pay us a fixed amount as revenue for each station during the first two
years, in equal installments at the beginning of each month.&#160; No payment was due from UPN in the third year
of the agreement.&#160; The amount received
from UPN had been recognized over the term of the agreement and a pro-rata
portion of the revenue had been deferred to be recognized in the third year.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;2, 2006, we entered into a Release and
Settlement Agreement with The WB and UPN, in which we released The WB and UPN,
and The WB and UPN released us, from any claims or other liabilities we or The
WB or UPN may have arising out of or in connection with (a)&nbsp;any agreement,
including any affiliation agreements entered into by us with The WB or UPN, and
(b)&nbsp;any services previously performed by any one of the parties to the
Release and Settlement Agreement for any other party to the Release and
Settlement Agreement.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of this agreement, we have
changed the revenue recognition period from an end date of July&nbsp;31, 2007
to an end date of September&nbsp;30, 2006, when UPN ceased broadcasting.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, we
recorded UPN network compensation of $0.9 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-16</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-16',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cc.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:17 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restructuring Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, we incurred costs in our broadcast
segment associated with restructuring the news operations at certain of our
stations.&#160; Specifically, on or before March&nbsp;31,
2006, we ceased our locally-produced news broadcasts in nine of our markets
and, consequently, let go our news employees and cancelled our news-related
contracts.&#160; We recorded restructuring
charges in station production expenses.&#160;
As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, there was no remaining unpaid balance
related to the restructuring plan.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Advertising
Expenses</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising expenses are recorded in the period when
incurred and are included in station production expenses.&#160; Total advertising expenses from continuing
operations, net of advertising co-op credits, were $8.4 million, $7.7 million
and $8.3 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We receive, from time to time, up front payments from
service providers.&#160; Such amounts are
recognized as a reduction in selling, general and administrative expenses on a
straight-line basis over the term of the contracts.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financial
Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial instruments, as of December&nbsp;31, 2007
and 2006, consisted of cash and cash equivalents, trade accounts receivable,
notes receivable (which are included in other current assets), derivatives,
accounts payable, accrued liabilities and notes payable.&#160; The carrying amounts approximate fair value
for each of these financial instruments, except for the notes payable.&#160; See <i>Note
6. Notes Payable and Commercial Bank Financing,</i> for additional
information regarding the fair value of notes payable.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Pension</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
September&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued SFAS 158, <i>Employers&#146;
Accounting for Defined Benefit Pension and Other Postretirement Plans, an
amendment of FASB Statements No.&nbsp;87, 88, 106 and 132(R)&nbsp;</i>(SFAS
158).&#160; SFAS 158 requires us to recognize
the funded status (i.e., the difference between the fair value of plan assets
and the projected benefit obligations) of our pension plan in our consolidated
financial statements.&#160; At adoption, we
recorded an adjustment to accumulated other comprehensive loss of $2.5 million
(net of taxes of $1.7 million) that represented the net unrecognized actuarial
losses which we previously netted against the plan&#146;s funded status in our
consolidated financial statements pursuant to the provisions of Statement
87.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and
2006, we have recognized a liability of zero and $0.4 million, respectively,
representing the under funded status of our defined benefit pension plan, which
is included in other long-term liabilities in the accompanying consolidated
balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reclassifications</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain reclassifications have been made to prior
years&#146; consolidated financial statements to conform to the current year&#146;s
presentation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>STOCK-BASED
COMPENSATION PLANS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Description of Awards</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have seven types of
stock-based compensation awards: compensatory stock options (options),
restricted stock awards (RSAs), an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP),
employer matching contributions (the Match) for participants in our 401(k)&nbsp;plan,
stock-settled appreciation rights (SARS), subsidiary stock awards and stock
grants to our non-employee directors.&#160;
Below is a summary of the key terms and methods of valuation of our
stock-based compensation awards:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Options.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;1996, our Board of Directors adopted,
upon approval of the shareholders by proxy, the 1996 Long-Term Incentive Plan
(LTIP).&#160; The purpose of the LTIP is to reward
key individuals for making major contributions to our success and the success
of our subsidiaries and to attract and retain the services of qualified and
capable employees.&#160; Options granted
pursuant to the LTIP must be exercised within 10 years following the grant
date.&#160; A total of 14,000,000 shares of Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock are reserved for awards under this plan.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, 10,245,384
shares (including forfeited shares) were available for future grants.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-17</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;21, 2005,
we accelerated the vesting of 390,039 stock options, which were all of our
outstanding unvested options at that time.&#160;
We accelerated the vesting of these options to prevent recognizing an
expense of approximately $0.8 million, before taxes, in 2006 and future
periods.&#160; The acceleration of the vesting
resulted in a modification to the original options.&#160; In accordance with FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;44,
<i>Accounting for Certain Transactions Involving
Stock-Based Compensation </i>(FIN 44), we recorded an immaterial
compensation charge based on the intrinsic value of the awards (as defined by
FIN 44) as measured on the modification date.&#160;
The exercise prices of these options ranged from $7.39 to $15.19 per
share and there was no material impact to earnings as a result of this
acceleration because most options had an exercise price that was above the
trading price on the vesting date.&#160; We
have not issued any options subsequent to accelerating the vesting in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a summary of changes in
outstanding stock options:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not expect to issue
options in future periods.&#160; In the event
the Board of Directors decides to issue options, we would be required to
determine the method we would use to estimate the fair value, such as the
Black-Scholes method or a lattice method.&#160;
Additionally, we would be required to estimate certain assumptions,
including expected volatility and estimated forfeitures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Designated
Participants Stock Option Plan</font></i><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">.&nbsp; In connection with our
initial public offering in June&nbsp;1995, our Board of Directors adopted an
Incentive Stock Option Plan for Designated Participants (Designated
Participants Stock Option Plan) pursuant to which options for shares of Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock were granted to certain of our key employees.&nbsp; Options
granted pursuant to Designated Participants Stock Option Plan must be exercised
within 10 years following the grant date.&nbsp; As of December&nbsp;31, 2005,
no shares were available for future grants because the Plan expired in June&nbsp;2005,
the tenth anniversary date of the Plan.&#160;
The Designated Participants Stock Option Plan participants forfeited
shares during 2007.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31,
2007, there were 5,000 shares outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">RSAs.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">RSAs are granted to employees pursuant to the
LTIP.&#160; RSAs have certain restrictions
that lapse over three years at 25%, 25% and 50%, respectively.&#160; As the restrictions lapse, the stock may be
freely traded on the open market.&#160; On April&nbsp;2,
2007, we awarded 55,500 RSAs that had a fair value of $15.78 per share, which
was the value of the stock on the trading date immediately prior to the grant
date.&#160; On April&nbsp;3, 2006, we awarded
40,000 RSAs that had a fair value of $7.81 per share, which was the value of
the stock on the trading date immediately prior to the grant date.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, 10,000 shares
were vested.&#160; We did not issue any RSAs
in 2005.&#160; For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, we recorded expense of $0.3 </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-18</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">million and less than
$0.1 million, respectively; and we will continue to record expense related to
this grant using a straight-line methodology over the 3-year lapse period.&#160; This expense will reduce our consolidated
income, but it will have no effect on our consolidated cash flows.&#160; Additionally, any RSAs for which the
restrictions have lapsed will be included in total shares outstanding, which
will have a dilutive effect on our earnings per share.&#160; Any RSAs for which the restrictions have not
lapsed will be included in total equivalent shares outstanding, based on the
treasury stock method, which could have a dilutive effect on our diluted
earnings per share.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">ESPP.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
In March&nbsp;1998, the Board of Directors adopted, subject to approval
of the shareholders, the ESPP.&#160; The ESPP
provides our employees with an opportunity to become shareholders through a convenient
arrangement for purchasing shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock.&#160; On the first day of each payroll deduction
period, each participating employee receives options to purchase a number of
shares of our common stock with money that is withheld from his or her
paycheck. The number of shares available to the participating employee is
determined at the end of the payroll deduction period by dividing the total
amount of money withheld during the payroll deduction period by the exercise
price of the options (as described below). Options granted under the ESPP to
employees are automatically exercised to purchase shares on the last day of the
payroll deduction period unless the participating employee has, at least thirty
days earlier, requested that his or her payroll contributions stop.&#160; Any cash accumulated in an employee&#146;s account
for a period in which an employee elects not to participate is distributed to
the employee.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The initial exercise
price for options under the ESPP is 85% of the lesser of the fair market value
of the common stock as of the first day of the payroll deduction period and as
of the last day of that period. No participant can purchase more than $25,000
worth of our common stock over all payroll deduction periods ending during the
same calendar year.&#160; We value the stock
options under the ESPP using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, which
incorporates the following assumptions as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr>
  <td width="42%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:42.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expected volatility</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:22.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38.38</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:6.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:20.58%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23.25</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.92%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="42%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:42.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Annual dividend yield</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:22.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.60</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:6.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:20.58%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.43</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.92%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use the Black-Scholes
model as opposed to a lattice pricing model because employee exercise patterns
are not relevant to this plan.&#160; The
risk-free interest rate is based on the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at
the time of grant.&#160; The expected life is
based on the approximate number of days in the quarter.&#160; The expected volatility is based on our
historical stock prices over the previous 90-day period.&#160; The annual dividend yield is based on the
annual dividend per share divided by the share price on the grant date.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The stock-based
compensation expense recorded related to the ESPP for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006 was $0.2 million and $0.1 million, respectively.&#160; Less than 0.1 million shares were issued to
employees during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; This expense reduced our consolidated income,
but it had no effect on our consolidated cash flows.&#160; See <i>2005 Pro Forma
Compensation</i> below for our accounting treatment during the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160;
Additionally, options issued under the ESPP are included in the total
shares outstanding at the end of each period, which results in a dilutive
effect on our basic and diluted earnings per share.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Match.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
The Sinclair Broadcast Group,&nbsp;Inc. 401(k)&nbsp;Profit Sharing Plan
and Trust (the 401(k)&nbsp;Plan) is available as a benefit for our eligible
employees.&#160; Contributions made to the 401(k)&nbsp;Plan
include an employee elected salary reduction amount, company-matching
contributions (the Match) and an additional discretionary amount determined
each year by the Board of Directors.&#160; The
Match and any discretionary contributions may be made using our Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock if the Board of Directors so chooses.&#160; In general, we make the Match using our Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The value of the Match is
based on the level of elective deferrals into the 401(k)&nbsp;plan.&#160; The amount of shares of our Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock used to make the Match is determined using the closing price on or
about March&nbsp;1<sup>st</sup> of each year for the previous calendar year&#146;s
Match.&#160; The Match is discretionary and is
equal to a maximum of 50% of elective deferrals by eligible employees, capped
at 4% of the employee&#146;s total cash compensation.&#160; For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007,
2006 and 2005, we recorded $1.9 million, $1.6 million and $1.7 million,
respectively, of compensation expense related to our match.&#160; The 2007 match of $1.9 million for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, will be made using our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
in March&nbsp;2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-19</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">SARs.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;2,
2007, 200,000 SARs were granted pursuant to the LTIP.&#160; The SARs have a 10-year term and vest
immediately.&#160; The SARs had a grant date
fair value of $1.0 million.&#160; We valued
the SARs using the Black-Scholes model and the following assumptions:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, we
recorded compensation expense of $1.0 million related to this grant.&#160; We did not issue any SARs in 2006 or
2005.&#160; This expense reduced our
consolidated income, but had no effect on our consolidated cash flows.&#160; During 2007, these SARs had no effect on the
shares used in our basic and diluted earnings per share.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Subsidiary Stock Awards</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; From time to time, we grant subsidiary stock
awards to employees.&#160; The subsidiary
stock is typically in the form of a membership interest in a consolidated
limited liability company, not traded on a public exchange and valued based on
the estimated fair value of the subsidiary.&#160;
Fair value is typically estimated using discounted cash flow models and
appraisals.&#160; These stock awards vest
immediately.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, we recorded compensation expense of $0.7 million related to these
awards.&#160; We did not issue any subsidiary
stock awards in 2006 or 2005.&#160; This
expense reduced our consolidated income, but had no effect on our consolidated
cash flows.&#160; These awards have no effect
on the shares used in our basic and diluted earnings per share.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock Grants to Non-Employee Directors.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; In addition to their base compensation, on
the date of each of our annual meetings of shareholders, each non-employee director
receives a grant of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the
LTIP.&#160; In 2007 and 2006, each
non-employee director received 5,000 shares and 2,000 shares,
respectively.&#160; On May&nbsp;10, 2007, we
granted 25,000 shares that had a fair value of $15.27 per share, which was the
closing value of the stock on the date of grant.&#160; On May&nbsp;11, 2006, we granted 10,000
shares that had a fair value of $8.09 per share, which was the closing value of
the stock on the date of grant.&#160; On August&nbsp;2,
2005, we granted 10,000 shares that had a fair value of $9.10 per share, which
was the closing value of the stock on the date of that grant.&#160; We recorded an expense of $0.4 million, less
than $0.1 million and less than $0.1 million on the date of grant for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; This expense reduced our consolidated income,
but it had no effect on our consolidated cash flows.&#160; Additionally, these shares are included in
the total shares outstanding, which results in a dilutive effect on our basic
and diluted earnings per share.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2005 Pro Forma Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, we applied the intrinsic value method of accounting for stock options as
prescribed by Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;25, <i>Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees,</i> which was
permitted by SFAS No.&nbsp;123, <i>Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation </i>(SFAS 123).&#160;
Accordingly, no expense was recognized for our options or shares granted
under the ESPP.&#160; Had compensation expense
related to our stock options and shares under the ESPP been determined
consistent with SFAS 123, our net income available to common shareholders for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 would approximate the pro forma amounts
below (in thousands, except per share data):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>INVESTMENTS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allegiance Capital Limited Partnership</font></u></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, our limited
partnership interest in Allegiance Capital Limited Partnership (Allegiance) was
96.7% and 97.0%, respectively.&#160;
Allegiance is a private mezzanine venture capital fund, which invests in
the subordinated debt and equity of privately held companies.&#160; The partnership is structured as a debenture
Small Business Investment Company (SBIC) and is a federally licensed SBIC.&#160; Since we do not have control, but only significant
influence, we account for our investment in Allegiance under the equity method
of accounting.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Atlantic Automotive Corporation</font></u></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;31, 2005, we
entered into an agreement with Auto Properties LLC, an affiliate of Atlantic
Automotive Corporation (&#147;Atlantic Automotive,&#148; formerly Summa Holdings, Ltd.)
to sell our 17.5% equity interest, or 21.22 shares, in Atlantic Automotive to
Auto Properties LLC for approximately $21.5 million in cash.&#160; On August&nbsp;2, 2005, the agreement between
us and Auto Properties LLC was nullified and we entered into new stock purchase
agreements with David D. Smith, our President and Chief Executive Officer and
Steven B. Fader, an unrelated third party, and entered into a stock redemption
agreement with Atlantic Automotive, totaling approximately $21.5 million.&#160; Pursuant to the stock purchase agreements, on
August&nbsp;2, 2005, 9.87 shares were sold to each party for $10.0 million in
cash and pursuant to the stock redemption agreements, Atlantic Automotive
redeemed the remaining 1.48 shares of our equity interest for $1.5 million in
cash.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have other cost and equity investments in private
investment funds, real estate ventures and privately held small
businesses.&#160; Management does not believe
that these investments individually, or in the aggregate, are material to the
accompanying consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event that one or
more of our investments are significant, we are required to disclose summarized
financial information.&#160; The table below
presents the unaudited summarized financial information for these investments
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:55.56%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term assets</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impairment of
Investments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each quarter, we review
our investments for impairment.&#160; For any
investments that indicate a potential impairment, we estimate the fair values
of those investments using discounted cash flow models, unrelated third party
valuations or industry comparables, based on the various facts available to
us.&#160; As a result of these reviews, we
recorded impairments of $1.0 million in the consolidated statements of
operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and $1.5 million for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; No
impairment was recorded for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="17%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:17.32%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation related to capital leases is included in
depreciation expense in the consolidated statements of operations.&#160; We recorded depreciation expense of $4.8
million, $4.9 million and $4.6 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the first quarter of 2003, one of our towers in
Charleston, West Virginia collapsed during a severe ice storm.&#160; This tower was insured and we used the
insurance settlement to rebuild the tower and to replace the other assets that
were destroyed by the collapse.&#160; In the
fourth quarter of 2004, we completed substantially all of the construction of
the new tower and placed it in service.&#160;
At that time, we recognized a gain of $3.3 million, representing amounts
received from insurance above the net book value of the old tower.&#160; Of this amount, $0.1 million was related to
business interruption insurance recoveries.&#160;
In 2005, we recognized a gain of $1.2 million, which represented
additional amounts received from the insurance settlement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>GOODWILL AND
OTHER INTANGIBLE ASSETS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No.&nbsp;142, <i>Goodwill
and Other Intangible Assets</i> (SFAS 142) requires that goodwill be
tested for impairment at the reporting unit level at least annually.&#160; We have determined that our designated
marketing areas (DMAs) are reporting units under SFAS 142.&#160; Annually, we test for impairment by comparing
the book value of our reporting units, including goodwill, to the estimated
fair value of our reporting units.&#160; We
estimate the fair value of our reporting units using a combination of observed
earnings multiples paid for comparable television stations, discounted cash
flow models and appraisals.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We test our goodwill and indefinite-lived intangible
assets for impairment annually as of October&nbsp;1, using the methodologies
provided in SFAS 142.&#160; There was no
impairment charge recorded for 2007 and 2005 based on the results of our
testing.&#160; In 2006, we determined that the
carrying value of goodwill of a reporting unit exceeded its fair value.&#160; As required, we calculated the fair value of
goodwill, and as a result, we recorded an $11.9 million impairment charge in
our consolidated statements of operations during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-22</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-22',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741323\2529-1-ce.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 02:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Definite-lived intangible assets and other assets
subject to amortization are being amortized on a straight-line basis over
periods of 5 to 25 years.&#160; These amounts
result from the acquisition of certain television station non-license
assets.&#160; We analyze specific
definite-lived intangibles for impairment when events occur that may impact
their value in accordance with Statement 144, <i>Accounting
for Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</i>.&#160; There was no impairment charge recorded for
2007 and 2005.&#160; During the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and in conjunction with the above-mentioned impairment of goodwill, we
determined that the decaying advertiser base definite-lived intangible asset of
a station was impaired and as a result, we recorded a $3.7 million impairment
charge in our consolidated statement of operations.&#160; The following table shows the gross carrying
amount and accumulated amortization of intangibles and estimated amortization
related to continuing operations (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, the carrying
amount of our broadcast licenses related to continuing operations was $401.1
million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The change in the carrying amount of goodwill related
to continuing operations was as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006, the primary change in
goodwill was the result of the recognition of tax benefits related to purchase
business combinations.&#160; See <i>Note 10. Income Taxes</i>, for further information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes goodwill from the acquisitions
of Triangle and Alarm Funding.&#160; We expect
to finalize the purchase price allocation for Alarm Funding in first quarter
2008.&#160; See <i>Note 1.
Acquisitions</i>, for further information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>NOTES PAYABLE
AND COMMERCIAL BANK FINANCING</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Bank Credit
Agreement</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;12, 2005, we
amended and restated our existing Bank Credit Agreement, lowering our annual
interest rate.&#160; The Bank Credit Agreement
in effect on December&nbsp;31, 2005, included a Term Loan A Facility (the Term
Loan A) of $100.0 million and a Revolving Credit Facility (the Revolver) of
$175.0 million maturing on December&nbsp;31, 2011 and June&nbsp;30, 2011,
respectively.&#160; As part of the amendment,
we fully redeemed our $150.0 million Term Loan A Facility and $250.0 million
Term Loan C Facility with proceeds from the sale of KOVR-TV in Sacramento,
California, cash on hand and the $100.0 million Term Loan A.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-23</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
