<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-23',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741323\2529-1-ce.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 02:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;21, 2006, we amended and restated the
Bank Credit Agreement again.&#160; As part of
the amendment, in addition to the Term Loan A and the Revolver, the Bank Credit
Agreement now includes a Term Loan A-1 facility (the Term Loan A-1) of $225.0
million maturing on December&nbsp;31, 2012.&#160;
On January&nbsp;19, 2007, we borrowed net proceeds of $225.0 million under
our Term Loan A-1 and used these proceeds, along with cash on hand and
additional borrowing, to fully redeem our 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes, due
2011.&#160; See <i>8.75% Senior
Subordinated Notes, Due 2011</i> below for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Availability under the
Revolver does not reduce incrementally and terminates at maturity.&#160; We are required to prepay the Term Loan A-1
and Term Loan A and reduce the Revolver with (i)&nbsp;100% of the net proceeds
of any casualty loss or condemnation and (ii)&nbsp;100% of the net proceeds of
any sale or other disposition of our assets in excess of $5.0 million in the
aggregate in any 12 month period, to the extent such proceeds are not used to
acquire new assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled payments on the
Term Loan A, Term Loan A-1 and Revolver are calculated at the London Interbank
Offered Rate (LIBOR) plus 1.25%, with step-downs tied to a leverage grid.&#160; We have the right to terminate the Term Loan
A, Term Loan A-1 or Revolver at any time without prepayment penalty.&#160; The Term Loan A is repayable in quarterly
installments, amortizing as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.25% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2007 to December&nbsp;31, 2008</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.75% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2009 to December&nbsp;31, 2010</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15.0% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2011 and continuing through its maturity on December&nbsp;31, 2011.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Term Loan A-1 is
repayable in quarterly installments, amortizing as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.25% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2009 to December&nbsp;31, 2009</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.50% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2010 to December&nbsp;31, 2010</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.75% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2011 to December&nbsp;31, 2011</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17.50% per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31,
2012 and continuing through its maturity on December&nbsp;31, 2012.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of amending the Bank Credit Agreement,
during 2005, we incurred debt acquisition costs of $2.0 million and recognized
a loss of $1.6 million, which represents the write-off of certain debt
acquisition costs associated with indebtedness replaced by the new
facilities.&#160; The loss was computed in
accordance with EITF No.&nbsp;96-19,<i> Debtor&#146;s
Accounting for a Modification or Exchange of Debt Instruments</i>.&#160; As
a result of amending the Bank Credit Agreement, during 2006, we incurred debt
acquisition costs of $1.6 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Bank Credit Agreement
is not publicly traded on a market; therefore, it is not practicable for us to
calculate the fair value associated with this financial instrument.&#160; The weighted average interest rates of the
Term Loan A for the year and the month ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 were 5.99%
and 5.56%, respectively.&#160; The weighted
average interest rates of the Term Loan A for the year and the month ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, were 5.88% and 6.07%, respectively.&#160;
The weighted average interest rates of the Term Loan A-1 for the year
and month ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, were 6.25% and 5.81%,
respectively.&#160; During 2007, 2006 and
2005, the interest expense relating to the Bank Credit Agreement was $19.6
million, $6.0 million and $9.3 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.75% Senior
Subordinated Notes, Due 2011</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2001, we completed an issuance of
$310.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes,
due 2011 (the 8.75% Notes).&#160; Interest on
the 8.75% Notes is paid semiannually on June&nbsp;15 and December&nbsp;15 of
each year.&#160; The 8.75% Notes were issued
under an indenture among us, our subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005, we repurchased, in the open market, $2.6
million of the 8.75% Notes at face value.&#160;
The $0.2 million in costs related to these repurchases have been
recorded as a loss from extinguishment of debt in our consolidated statements
of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;19, 2007, we borrowed net proceeds of
$225.0 million under our Term Loan A-1 pursuant to our amended and restated
Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; On January&nbsp;22,
2007, we used these proceeds along with $59.4 million of cash on hand and
additional borrowings of $23.0 million under our Revolving Credit Facility to
redeem the aggregate principal amount of $307.4 million of our 8.75%
Notes.&#160; The redemption was effected in
accordance with the terms of the indenture governing the 8.75% Notes at a
redemption price of 104.375% of the principal amount of the 8.75% Notes plus
accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; As a result
of the redemption, we recorded a loss from extinguishment of debt of $15.7
million representing the redemption premium and write-off of certain debt
acquisition costs.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-24</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $1.6 million, $26.9 million and
$27.0 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; Based on the quoted market
price, the fair value of the 8.75% Notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 was
$322.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.0% Senior
Subordinated Notes, Due 2012</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From March&nbsp;2002 through May&nbsp;29, 2003, we
issued $650.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8.0% Senior Subordinated
Notes, due 2012 (the 8.0% Notes).&#160;
Interest on the 8.0% Notes is paid semiannually on March&nbsp;15 and September&nbsp;15
of each year, beginning September&nbsp;15, 2002.&#160; The 8.0% Notes were issued under an indenture
among us, certain of our subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;11,
2007 and June&nbsp;18, 2007, we partially redeemed $300.0 million and $45.0
million, respectively, of our existing 8.0% Notes at a redemption price of 104%
of the principal amount of the 8.0% Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest with
net proceeds from the offering of the 3.0% Convertible Senior Notes, due 2027
(the 3.0% Notes) and cash on hand.&#160; As a
result of the partial redemption, we recorded a loss from extinguishment of
debt of $15.0 million representing the redemption premium and write-off of
certain debt acquisition costs, a debt premium and an unamortized derivative
asset.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the
partial redemption noted above, during 2007 and 2006, we repurchased, in the
open market, $9.9 million and $23.7 million, respectively, of the 8.0% Notes at
face value.&#160; The $2.3 million and $0.4
million in costs related to these repurchases for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively, have been recorded as a loss from extinguishment
of debt in our consolidated statements of operations.&#160; During January&nbsp;2008, we repurchased, in
the open market, $6.9 million of the 8.0% Notes at face value.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the outstanding
face amount of the 8.0% Notes was $263.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We may redeem all of the
8.0% Notes on or after March&nbsp;15, 2007 at a redemption premium of 4.0%,
reducing incrementally to 0.0% after March&nbsp;15, 2010.&#160; We may consider making a tender offer to
repurchase some or all of these notes in the future.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was
$34.0 million, $50.2 million and $51.7 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Based
on the quoted market price, the fair market value of the 8.0% Notes was $269.3
million at December&nbsp;31, 2007 and $633.8 million at December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">6.0% Convertible Debentures, Due 2012</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;15, 2005, we
completed an exchange of our Series&nbsp;D Convertible Exchangeable Preferred
Stock (the Preferred Stock) into Convertible Debentures, due 2012.&#160; Pursuant to the terms of the Preferred Stock,
a holder of the Preferred Stock received $1,000 principal amount of Convertible
Debentures for each $1,000 of liquidation preference of Preferred Stock held by
such holder at the Exchange Date, plus accrued but unpaid dividends through the
Exchange Date.&#160; Therefore, the annual
interest payments are consistent with the annual dividend payments of the
Preferred Stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Convertible
Debentures mature September&nbsp;15, 2012, and bear interest at a rate of 6.0%
per annum, payable quarterly on each March&nbsp;15, June&nbsp;15, September&nbsp;15
and December&nbsp;15, beginning September&nbsp;15, 2005.&#160; The Convertible Debentures are convertible
into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on substantially the same conversion terms as
the Preferred Stock at a conversion price of $22.813 per share, subject to
adjustment.&#160; We recorded the Convertible
Debentures at fair value upon issuance and the excess of the carrying amount of
the Preferred Stock over the fair value of the Convertible Debentures was added
to net earnings to arrive at net earnings available to common shareholders.&#160; The difference in the carrying amount of the
Preferred Stock and the fair value of the Convertible Debentures was recorded
as a discount on the Convertible Debentures and is being amortized over the
life of the Convertible Debentures using the effective interest method.&#160; Net costs associated with the exchange
totaled $0.1 million and these costs were capitalized and are being amortized
as interest expense over the life of the debt.&#160;
In connection with the exchange, we recorded a discount of $31.7 million
related to this redemption and we will amortize this amount over the life of
the debt using the effective interest method.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006 and 2005, we
repurchased, in the open market, $8.6 million and $5.0 million, respectively,
of the Convertible Debentures at a discount.&#160;
The $0.5 million and $0.3 million in costs related to these repurchases
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, respectively, have been
recorded as a loss from extinguishment of debt in our consolidated statements
of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We may redeem all of
these notes on or after September&nbsp;15, 2005 at a redemption premium of
1.2%, September&nbsp;15, 2006 at a redemption premium of 0.6% and reducing to
0.0% on or after September&nbsp;15, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense for the Convertible Debentures was
$9.2 million, $9.2 million and $7.1 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Based
on the quoted market price, the fair value of the Convertible Debentures as of December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, was $136.8 million and $139.7 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-25</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">4.875%
Convertible Senior Notes, Due 2018</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May&nbsp;2003, we completed a private placement
of $150.0 million aggregate principal amount of 4.875% Convertible Senior
Notes, due 2018 (the 4.875% Notes).&#160; The
4.875% Notes were issued at par, mature on July&nbsp;15, 2018, and have the
following characteristics:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the 4.875% Notes are convertible into shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock at the option of the holder upon certain circumstances.&#160; The conversion price is $22.37 until March&nbsp;31,
2011, at which time the conversion price increases quarterly until reaching $28.07
on July&nbsp;15, 2018;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the 4.875% Notes may be put to us at par on January&nbsp;15, 2011 or
called thereafter by us;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the 4.875% Notes bear cash interest at an annual rate of 4.875% until January&nbsp;15,
2011 and bear cash interest at an annual rate of 2.00% from January&nbsp;15,
2011 through maturity;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the principal amount of the 4.875% Notes will accrete to 125.66% of the
original par amount from January&nbsp;15, 2011 to maturity so that when
combined with the cash interest, the yield to maturity of the 4.875% Notes will
be 4.875% per year; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">under certain circumstances, we will pay contingent cash interest to
the holders of the 4.875% Notes during any six month period from January&nbsp;15
to July&nbsp;14 and from July&nbsp;15 to January&nbsp;14, commencing with the
six month period beginning January&nbsp;15, 2011.&#160; This contingent cash interest feature is an
embedded derivative which had a negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $7.3 million for each of the
years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Based on the quoted market price, the fair
market value of the 4.875% Notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 was
$138.4 million and $137.3 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">3.0% Convertible
Senior Notes, Due 2027</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;10,
2007, we completed an offering of $300.0 million aggregate principal amount of
3.0% Convertible Senior Notes, due 2027 (the 3.0% Notes).&#160;&#160; Upon certain conditions, the 3.0% Notes are
convertible into cash and, in certain circumstances, shares of Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock.&#160; If the 3.0% Notes are
converted into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock prior to maturity, they are
convertible&#160; at an initial conversion
price of $20.43 per share, subject to adjustment, which is equal to an initial
conversion rate of approximately 48.9476 shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
per $1,000 principal amount of notes.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 3.0% Notes may
be surrendered for conversion at any time on or before November&nbsp;15, 2026
if the following conditions are met:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Symbol" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">during any calendar
quarter commencing after the date of original issuance of the 3.0% Notes, if
the closing sale price of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, for at least 20
trading days in the period of 30 consecutive trading days ending on the last
trading day of the calendar quarter preceding the quarter in which the
conversion occurs, is more than 130% of the conversion price in effect on that
last trading day;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Symbol" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">during the ten
consecutive trading day period following any five consecutive trading day
period in which the trading price for the 3.0% Notes for each such trading day
was less than 95% of the closing sale price of our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on
such date multiplied by the then current conversion rate;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Symbol" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">if the 3.0% Notes
have been called for redemption; or</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Symbol" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">if we make certain
significant distributions to our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock shareholders, we
enter into specified corporate transactions or our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
ceases to be listed on The NASDAQ Global Select Market and is not listed for
trading on another U.S. national or regional securities exchange.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The 3.0% Notes may be surrendered for conversion after
November&nbsp;15, 2026, and at any time prior to the close of business on the
business day immediately preceding the maturity date regardless of whether any
of the foregoing conditions have been satisfied.&#160; Upon a fundamental change, holders of the
3.0% Notes may require us to repurchase for cash all or part of their notes at
a repurchase price equal to 100.0% of the principal amount plus accrued and
unpaid interest. Holders of the 3.0% Notes will also have the right to require
us to repurchase the notes for cash on May&nbsp;15, 2010, May&nbsp;15, 2017 and
May&nbsp;15, 2022, or any other such date to be determined by us at a
repurchase price payable in cash equal to the aggregate principal amount plus
accrued and unpaid interest (including contingent cash interest), if any,
through the repurchase date. The 3.0% Notes require us to settle the principal
amount in cash and the conversion spread in cash or net shares at our option.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-26</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-26',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are required to
pay contingent cash interest to the holders of the 3.0% Notes during any
six-month period from May&nbsp;15 to November&nbsp;14 and from November&nbsp;15
to May&nbsp;14, commencing with the period beginning May&nbsp;20, 2010 if the
average note price for the applicable five trading day period equals 120% or
more of the principal amount of such notes and in certain other
circumstances.&#160; The amount of contingent
cash interest payable per note in respect of any six-month period will equal
0.375% per year of the average note price for the applicable five trading day
period.&#160; The 3.0% Notes may not be redeemed
prior to May&nbsp;20, 2010 and may thereafter be redeemed by us at par.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;18, 2007, the underwriters of the 3.0%
Notes exercised their option to purchase up to an additional aggregate $45.0
million principal amount of the 3.0% Notes.&#160;
The offering was made pursuant to our universal shelf registration
statement previously filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; Net costs associated with the offering
totaled $6.7 million.&#160; These costs were
capitalized and are being amortized as interest expense over the life of the
debt.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $6.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007.&#160; Based on the quoted market price,
the fair market value of the 3.0% Notes was $311.8 million as of December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cunningham Term
Loan Facility</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;28, 2006,
Cunningham Broadcasting Corporation (Cunningham), one of our consolidated VIEs,
amended its $33.5 million Term Loan Facility originally entered into on March&nbsp;20,
2002, with an unrelated third party.&#160;
Cunningham is in negotiations to extend the maturity to June&nbsp;30,
2008.&#160; Interest is paid quarterly at a
rate of LIBOR plus 1.5%.&#160; During 2007,
2006 and 2005, the interest expense relating to the Term Loan was $2.3 million,
$2.4 million and $1.9 million, respectively.&#160;
Primarily all of Cunningham&#146;s assets are collateral for the Term
Loan.&#160; The Term Loan Facility is
non-recourse to us.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Operating
Divisions&#146; Company Debt</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other
operating divisions&#146; company debt includes debt of our consolidated
subsidiaries with non-broadcasting related operations.&#160; This debt is non-recourse to us.&#160; Interest is paid on this debt at rates
ranging from LIBOR plus 3.0% with step-downs tied to a leverage grid to 6.11%
during 2007.&#160; During 2007, interest
expense on this debt was $0.6 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Summary</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes payable, capital leases and the Bank Credit
Agreement consisted of the following as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Substantially all of our stock in our wholly-owned
subsidiaries has been pledged as security for the Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had 27 capital leases
with non-affiliates, including 25 tower leases, one building lease and one
equipment lease.&#160; All of our tower leases
will expire within the next 30 years and the building lease will expire within
the next 10 years.&#160; Most of our leases
have 5-10 year renewal options and it is expected that these leases will be
renewed or replaced within the normal course of business.&#160; For more information related to our affiliate
notes and capital leases, see <i>Note 12.</i>  <i>Related Person Transactions</i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>PROGRAM
CONTRACTS PAYABLE</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future payments required under program contracts as of
December&nbsp;31, 2007 were as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

  <td width="19%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:19.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,566</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="66%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:66.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2012 and thereafter</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:19.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,815</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="66%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:66.14%;">

  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:19.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">170,193</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="66%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:66.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less: Current portion</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:19.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(90,208</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0.375pt .7pt;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="66%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:66.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term portion of program contracts payable</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.08%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:17.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">79,985</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each
future periods&#146; film liability includes contractual amounts owed, however, what
is contractually owed doesn&#146;t necessarily reflect what we are expected to pay
during that period.&#160; While we are legally
contractually bound to make the payments reflected in the table during the
indicated periods, industry protocol typically enables us to make film payments
on a three-month lag.&#160; Included in the
current portion amounts are payments due in arrears of $21.0 million.&#160; In addition, we have entered into
non-cancelable commitments for future program rights aggregating $117.3 million
as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We perform a net realizable value calculation
quarterly for each of our non-cancelable commitments in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;63,
<i>Financial Reporting for Broadcasters</i>.&#160; We utilize sales information to estimate the
future revenue of each commitment and measure that amount against the
commitment.&#160; If the estimated future
revenue is less than the amount of the commitment, a loss is recorded.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We estimated the fair value of our program contracts
payable and non-cancelable commitments at approximately $148.9 million and
$92.4 million, respectively, as of December&nbsp;31, 2007, and $159.7 million
and $89.5 million, respectively, as of December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; These estimates were based on future cash
payments discounted at our current borrowing rate.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-28</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-28',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">COMMON STOCK AND PREFERRED
STOCK</font></u></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Common Stock</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holders of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock are entitled to
one vote per share and holders of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock are entitled to ten
votes per share, except for votes relating to &#147;going private&#148; and certain other
transactions.&#160; The Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock and the Class&nbsp;B Common Stock vote together as a single class, except
as otherwise may be required by Maryland law, on all matters presented for a
vote.&#160; Holders of Class&nbsp;B Common
Stock may at any time convert their shares into the same number of shares of Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock.&#160; During 2007, 3,894,473 Class&nbsp;B
Common Stock shares were converted into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock shares.&#160; During 2006, there was no Class&nbsp;B Common
Stock converted into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock shares.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Bank Credit Agreement
and some of our subordinated debt instruments have general restrictions on the
amount of dividends that may be paid.&#160;
Under the indentures governing the 8.0% Notes, we are restricted from
paying dividends on our common stock unless certain specified conditions are
satisfied, including that:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">no event of default then exists under the
indenture or certain other specified agreements relating to our indebtedness;
and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">after taking account of the dividend, we
are within certain restricted payment requirements contained in the indenture.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, under
certain of our senior unsecured debt, the payment of dividends is not
permissible during a default thereunder.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
2006, the Board of Directors voted to increase the dividend once.&#160; The 2006 dividends declared were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$0.500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.94%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">October&nbsp;12, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.88%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="26%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:26.76%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">December&nbsp;31, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$0.125</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.94%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$0.500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.94%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:21.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">January&nbsp;12, 2007</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.88%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2007, the Board of Directors voted to
increase the dividend twice.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;14, 2007, we announced
that our Board of Directors approved an increase to our annual dividend to 60
cents per share from 50 cents per share.&#160;
On October&nbsp;31, 2007, we
announced that our Board of Directors approved an increase to our annual
dividend to 70 cents per share from 60 cents per share.&#160; We began paying this dividend rate in the
first quarter 2008.&#160; On February&nbsp;6,
2008, we announced that our Board of Directors approved an increase to our
annual dividend to 80 cents per share from 70 cents per share.&#160; We intend to declare dividend distributions
in each future quarter.&#160; The 2007
dividends declared were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
February&nbsp;5, 2008, our Board of Directors renewed its authorization to
repurchase up to $150.0 million of the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on the open
market or through private transactions.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Preferred Stock</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 1997, we completed a public offering of
3,450,000 shares of Series&nbsp;D Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock (the
Preferred Stock).&#160; The Preferred Stock
had a liquidation preference of $50 per share and a stated cumulative dividend
of $3.00 per share payable quarterly out of legally available funds and was
convertible into shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock at the option of the
holders thereof at a conversion price of $22.813 per share, subject to
adjustment.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;15, 2005, we completed a redemption of
the Preferred Stock by exchanging the Preferred Stock for 6% Convertible
Debentures, due 2012.&#160; Pursuant to the
terms of the Preferred Stock, a holder of the Preferred Stock received $1,000
principal amount of Convertible Debentures for each $1,000 of liquidation
preference of Preferred Stock held by such holder at the Exchange Date, plus
accrued but unpaid dividends through the Exchange Date.&#160; We recorded a $26.2 million discount that was
</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-29</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-29',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">added
to net earnings available to common shareholders representing the excess of the
carrying amount of the Preferred Stock over the fair value of the Convertible
Debentures.&#160; See <i>Note 6.
Notes Payable and Commercial Bank Financing,</i> for further description
of the 6% Convertible Debentures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>DERIVATIVE
INSTRUMENTS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We enter into derivative instruments primarily to
reduce the impact of changing interest rates on our floating rate debt and to
reduce the impact of changing fair market values on our fixed rate debt.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with SFAS 133,<i> Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</i>,
SFAS No.&nbsp;137, <i>Accounting for Derivative
Instruments and Hedging Activities - Deferral of the Effective Date of FASB
Statement No.&nbsp;133</i> and SFAS No.&nbsp;138, <i>Accounting for Certain Derivative Instruments and
Certain Hedging Activities, an amendment of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;133</i>
(collectively, SFAS 133), our losses resulting from prior year terminations of
fixed to floating interest rate agreements were reflected as a discount on our
fixed rate debt and were being amortized to interest expense through December&nbsp;15,
2007, the original expiration date of the terminated swap agreements.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007,
amortization of the discount of $0.4 million was recorded as interest
expense.&#160; For each of the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, amortization of the discount of $0.5 million was recorded as
interest expense.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;20, 2006, we terminated two of our
derivative instruments with a cash payment of $3.8 million, the aggregate fair
value of the derivative liabilities on that date.&#160; These swap agreements were accounted for as
fair value hedges in accordance with SFAS 133 and changes in their fair market
values were reflected as adjustments to the carrying value of the underlying
debt that was being hedged.&#160; Therefore,
on the termination date, the carrying value of the underlying debt was adjusted
to reflect the $3.8 million payment and that amount will be treated as a discount
on the underlying debt that was being hedged and will be amortized over its
remaining life, in accordance with SFAS 133.&#160;
Amortization of the discount of $0.4 million was recorded as interest
expense for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;5, 2006, two of our derivative
instruments expired.&#160; These expired swap
agreements did not qualify for hedge accounting treatment under SFAS 133 and,
therefore, the changes in their fair market values were reflected in historical
earnings as an unrealized gain from derivative instruments through the
expiration date.&#160; For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, we recorded an unrealized gain of $2.9 million and $21.8
million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had two remaining
derivative instruments.&#160; Both of these instruments
are interest rate swap agreements.&#160; One
of these swap agreements, with a notional amount of $180.0 million and expiring
March&nbsp;15, 2012, is accounted for as a fair value hedge; therefore, any
changes in its fair market value are reflected as an adjustment to the carrying
value of our 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2012, which is the underlying
debt being hedged.&#160; During 2006, the
other interest rate swap agreement was undesignated as a fair value hedge due
to a reassignment of the counterparty; therefore, any subsequent changes in the
fair market value are reflected as an adjustment to income.&#160; The notional amount of this swap agreement is
$120.0 million and it expires on March&nbsp;15, 2012.&#160; The interest we pay on the $180.0 million
interest rate swap agreement is floating based on the three-month LIBOR plus
2.28% and the interest we receive is at 8.0%.&#160;
The $120.0 million swap is structured identically with the exception of
a difference in the interest spread where it is 2.35%.&#160; The fair market value of these agreements is
estimated by obtaining quotations from the international financial institution
which is a party to the contract.&#160; This
fair value is an estimate of the net amount that we would pay on the balance
sheet date if we cancelled the contracts or transferred them to other parties
and includes net accrued interest receivable or payable.&#160; This amount was a net asset of $12.8 million
and $5.7 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; During February&nbsp;2008, the counterparty
to each of these two derivative instruments terminated the agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May&nbsp;2003, we completed an issuance of
$150.0 million aggregate principal amount of 4.875% Convertible Senior Notes,
due 2018.&#160; During May&nbsp;2007, we
completed an issuance of $345.0 million aggregate principal of 3.0% Convertible
Senior Notes, due 2027.&#160; Under certain
circumstances, we will pay contingent cash interest to the holder of the
convertible notes commencing on January&nbsp;15, 2011 and May&nbsp;10, 2010 for
the 4.875% Notes and 3.0% Notes, respectively.&#160;
The contingent cash interest feature for both are embedded derivatives
which had a negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; The embedded derivative for the 4.875% Notes
had a negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-30</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-30',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->

<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>INCOME TAXES</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We file a consolidated federal income tax return and
separate company state tax returns.&#160; The
provision (benefit) for income taxes consisted of the following for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a reconciliation of federal income
taxes at the applicable statutory rate to the recorded provision from
continuing operations:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="54%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:54.16%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.24%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2007</font></b></p>
  </td>

carrying amounts and the tax basis of assets and liabilities give rise to
deferred taxes.&#160; Total deferred tax
assets and deferred tax liabilities as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 were

  <td width="53%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:53.98%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.24%;">

  </td>

  </td>
