<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-31</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-31',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our remaining federal and state net operating losses
will expire during various years from 2008 to 2027 and, in certain cases, are
subject to annual limitations under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;382 or
under Treasury Regulation 1.1502-21 and similar state provisions.&#160; The pre-valuation-allowance tax effects of
the federal net operating losses were $9.5 million as of both December&nbsp;31,
2007 and December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The
pre-valuation-allowance tax effects of the state net operating losses were
$77.5 million and $84.3 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and December&nbsp;31,
2006, respectively.&#160;&#160; The above-mentioned
tax attributes were recorded in the deferred tax accounts in the accompanying
consolidated balance sheets.&#160; During the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, we realized a non-recurring loss of certain
state net operating losses, net of applicable valuation allowances, resulting
from a corporate restructuring and recorded a reduction of deferred tax assets
through our deferred tax provision from continuing operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We establish valuation allowances in accordance with
the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;109, <i>Accounting
for Income Taxes</i>.&#160; In
evaluating our ability to realize net deferred tax assets, we consider all
available evidence, both positive and negative, including our past operating
results, tax planning strategies and forecasts of future taxable income.&#160; In considering these sources of taxable
income, we must make certain assumptions and judgments that are based on the
plans and estimates used to manage our underlying businesses. A valuation
allowance has been provided for deferred tax assets relating to various federal
and state net operating losses that are carried forward based on expected
timing of the reversals of existing temporary book/tax basis differences,
alternative tax strategies and projected future taxable income.&#160; Although realization is not assured for the
remaining deferred tax assets, we believe it is more likely than not that they
will be realized in the future.&#160; During
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, we decreased our valuation allowances by
$8.4 million.&#160; This change was primarily
a result of actual pre-valuation-allowance tax effects of prior year state NOLs
being less than we forecasted. Since those NOLs carried a full valuation
allowance, a corresponding reduction was warranted.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, future
reversals of valuation allowance would primarily be made through a reduction of
our tax provision rather than goodwill or other non current intangible assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We adjusted the net deferred tax liabilities for
changes in enacted state tax rates, apportionment rules&nbsp;and filing
regimes, where applicable.&#160; The total
amount of these adjustments did not have a significant impact on our
consolidated balance sheets, consolidated statements of operations or
consolidated statements of cash flows, except for the New York, Texas and Ohio
tax law changes in 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Enacted as part of the 2007-08 New York
budget legislation, Senate Bill 2110 includes mandatory combined reporting,
shift to a single sales factor apportionment and a reduction in tax rate.&#160; Changes made by the new tax law are effective
for 2007 franchise tax reports originally due on or after March&nbsp;15,
2008.&nbsp; As a result, we recorded a deferred tax benefit of $1.0 million in
continuing operations to reflect an adjustment to our net deferred tax
liabilities in 2007.&#160; On May&nbsp;18,
2006, the Governor of the state of Texas signed into law House Bill 3.&nbsp;
This bill revises the existing franchise tax by changing the tax base, lowering
the rate and extending coverage to all active businesses receiving the state
law liability protection.&nbsp; Changes made by the new tax law are effective
for 2007 franchise tax reports originally due on or after January&nbsp;1,
2008.&nbsp; As a result, we recorded a deferred tax benefit of $1.5 million in
continuing operations to reflect an adjustment to our net deferred tax
liabilities in 2006.&#160; On June&nbsp;30,
2005, the Governor of the state of Ohio signed the Ohio Biennial Budget
Bill.&nbsp; The bill replaces the Ohio income and franchise tax with a
commercial activity tax, among other changes in Ohio law.&nbsp; As a result, we
recorded a deferred tax benefit of $5.2 million in continuing operations to
reflect an adjustment to our net deferred tax liabilities in 2005.&#160; During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007,
we recorded a deferred tax expense of $2.1 million in continuing operations
primarily related to changes in our state tax apportionments resulting in an
increase in our net deferred tax liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We adopted the provisions
of FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty
in Income Taxes</i> (FIN 48) on January&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; The adoption of FIN 48 did not cause a
material change to our contingent liability for unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; We decreased the January&nbsp;1, 2007 balance
in our accumulated deficit position by $0.6 million to apply the cumulative
effect of the FIN 48 adoption.&#160; As of the
date of adoption, we had $32.9 million of gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; Of this total, $17.6 million (net of federal
effect on state tax issues) and $7.8 million (net of federal effect on state
tax issues) represent the amounts of unrecognized tax benefits that, if
recognized, would favorably affect our effective tax rates from continuing
operations and discontinued operations, respectively.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had $28.0
million of gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160;
Of this total, $15.1 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues)
and $7.1 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues) represent the
amounts of unrecognized tax benefits that, if recognized, would favorably
affect our effective tax rates from continuing operations and discontinued
operations, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
summarizes the activity related to our accrued unrecognized tax benefits (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-32</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-32',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-cg.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:37 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, we recognize
accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income
tax expense.&#160; We had $6.7 million and $0
accrued for interest and penalties, respectively, at January&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; We recognized $0.4 million of income tax
expense for interest related to uncertain tax positions for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are subject to U.S.
federal income tax as well as income tax of multiple state jurisdictions.&#160; All of our 2004 and subsequent federal and
state tax returns remain subject to examination by various tax
authorities.&#160; Some of our pre-2004
federal and state tax returns may also be subject to examination.&#160; In addition, several of our subsidiaries are
currently under state examinations for various years.&#160; We do not anticipate the resolution of these
matters will result in a material change to our consolidated financial
statements.&#160; In addition, it is
reasonably possible that various statutes of limitations could expire by December&nbsp;31,
2008.&#160; We do not expect such expirations,
if any, would significantly change our unrecognized tax benefits over the next
twelve months.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management periodically performs a comprehensive
review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews, the status of
on-going audits and the expiration of applicable statute of limitations, these
accruals are adjusted as necessary.&#160; The
resolution of audits is unpredictable and could result in tax liabilities that
are significantly higher or lower than for what we have provided.&#160; Amounts accrued for these tax matters are
primarily included in long-term liabilities in our consolidated balance
sheets.&#160; We believe that adequate
accruals have been provided for all years.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2007, the statute of limitations expired for
certain state income tax returns for 1999 through 2003.&#160; As a result, we released $4.9 million of
discrete tax and related interest reserves, of which $3.9 million and $1.2
million were recorded as a reduction of income tax provision for continuing operations
and discontinued operations, respectively.&#160;
During 2006, the statute of limitations expired for the federal income
tax returns for 1999 through 2002.&#160; As a
result, we released $39.9 million of discrete tax and related interest
reserves, of which $14.4 million was recorded as a reduction to goodwill, $0.2
million reduced other identifiable intangible assets and $25.3 million was
recorded as a reduction of our income tax provision for continuing
operations.&#160; We have adjusted goodwill
and other identifiable intangibles to the extent the statute of limitations
expired for the exposures related to items on which reserves were recorded in
purchase accounting at the time of the related acquisitions.&#160; In addition, during 2006 we received a net
refund of approximately $4.3 million related to the abovementioned tax years
which resulted in a reduction of goodwill and deferred tax assets of $8.3
million and $0.8 million, respectively, and an increase in income tax provision
for continuing operations of $4.8 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recognized a $0.5
million and $3.5 million net tax benefit for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 and December&nbsp;31, 2006, respectively, primarily attributable to the
net adjustment of certain tax contingencies regarding tax returns related to
discontinued operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>COMMITMENTS
AND CONTINGENCIES</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Litigation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a party to lawsuits and claims from time to
time in the ordinary course of business.&#160;
Actions currently pending are in various preliminary stages and no
judgments or decisions have been rendered by hearing boards or courts in
connection with such actions.&#160; After
reviewing developments to date with legal counsel, our management is of the
opinion that the outcome of our pending and threatened matters will not have a
material adverse effect on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">FCC License
Renewals</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, we filed with the FCC an application for the
license renewal of WBFF-TV in Baltimore, Maryland.&#160; Subsequently, an individual named Richard D&#146;Amato
filed a petition to deny the application.&#160;
In 2004, we also filed with the FCC applications for the license renewal
of television stations: WXLV-TV, Winston-Salem, North Carolina; WMYV-TV,
Greensboro, North Carolina; WLFL-TV, Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WRDC-TV,
Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WLOS-TV, Asheville, North Carolina and WMMP-TV,
Charleston, South Carolina.&#160; An
organization calling itself &#147;Free Press&#148; filed a petition to deny the renewal
applications of these stations and also the renewal applications of two other
stations in those markets, which we program pursuant to LMAs: WTAT-TV,
Charleston, South Carolina and WMYA-TV (formerly WBSC-TV), Anderson, South
Carolina.&#160; Several individuals and an
organization named &#147;Sinclair Media Watch&#148; also filed informal objections to the
license renewal applications of WLOS-TV and WMYA-TV, raising essentially the
same arguments presented in the Free Press petition.&#160; The FCC is currently in the process of
considering these renewal applications and we believe the objections have no
merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;1, 2005, we filed applications with the
FCC requesting renewal of the broadcast licenses for WICS-TV and WICD-TV in
Springfield/Champaign, Illinois.&#160;
Subsequently, various viewers filed informal objections requesting that
the FCC </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-33</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ci.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">deny
these renewal applications.&#160; On September&nbsp;30,
2005, we filed an application with the FCC for the renewal of the broadcast
license for KGAN-TV in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.&#160;
On December&nbsp;28, 2005, an organization calling itself &#147;Iowans for
Better Local Television&#148; filed a petition to deny that application.&#160; The FCC is currently in the process of
considering these renewal applications and we believe the objections and
petitions requesting denial have no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;1, 2005, we filed applications with the
FCC requesting renewal of the broadcast licenses for WCGV-TV and WVTV-TV in
Milwaukee, Wisconsin.&#160; On November&nbsp;1,
2005, the Milwaukee Public Interest Media Coalition filed a petition to deny
these renewal applications.&#160; On June&nbsp;13,
2007, the Video Division of the FCC denied the petition to deny, and
subsequently, the Milwaukee Public Interest Media Coalition filed a petition
for reconsideration of that decision, which we opposed.&#160; The petition for reconsideration and the
renewal applications are currently pending.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;27,
2006, James Pennino purportedly filed a petition to deny the license renewal
application of WUCW-TV in Minneapolis, Minnesota.&#160; Despite not having found any official record
of the filing, we opposed the petition and the renewal application is currently
pending.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2007, the FCC granted
the license renewal applications of the following stations:&#160; WPGH-TV in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; WABM-TV
in Birmingham, Alabama; WNYO-TV in Buffalo, New York; and WNYS-TV in Syracuse,
New York.&#160; In January&nbsp;2008, the FCC
granted the license renewal applications of the following stations:&#160; KDNL-TV in St. Louis, Missouri; WZTV-TV in
Nashville, Tennessee; WSYX-TV in Columbus, Ohio; KABB-TV in San Antonio, Texas;
KMYS-TV in San Antonio, Texas; KVMY-TV in Las Vegas, Nevada; KOKH-TV in
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma; KOCB-TV in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma; WRLH-TV in
Richmond, Virginia; WEAR-TV in Pensacola, Florida; WKEF-TV in Dayton, Ohio;
WDKY-TV in Lexington, Kentucky; WSMH-TV in Flint, Michigan; KDSM-TV in Des
Moines, Iowa; KBSI-TV in Cape Girardeau, Missouri; and WTWC-TV in Tallahassee,
Florida.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other FCC Adjudicatory
Proceedings</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;21, 2005, we filed with the FCC an
application to acquire the license and non-license television broadcast assets
of WNAB-TV in Nashville, Tennessee.&#160; The
Rainbow/PUSH Coalition (Rainbow/PUSH) filed a petition to deny that application
and also requested that the FCC initiate a hearing to investigate whether
WNAB-TV was improperly operated with WZTV-TV and WUXP-TV, two of our stations
located in the same market as WNAB-TV.&#160;
The FCC is currently in the process of considering the transfer of the
broadcast license and we believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition has no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;12, 2004, the FCC issued a Notice of
Apparent Liability for Forfeiture (NAL) in the amount of $7,000 per station to
virtually every FOX station, including the 15 FOX affiliates presently licensed
to us and the four FOX affiliates programmed by us and one FOX affiliate we
sold in 2005.&#160; The NAL alleged that the
stations broadcast indecent material contained in an episode of a FOX network
program that aired on April&nbsp;7, 2003.&#160;
We, as well as other parties including the FOX network, filed
oppositions to the NAL.&#160; On February&nbsp;22,
2008, the FCC released an order fining several FOX stations, including KDSM-TV
in Des Moines, Iowa, WZTV-TV in Nashville, Tennessee, and WVAH-TV in
Charleston, West Virginia, which we program pursuant to an LMA.&#160; Under the order, the affected stations have
until March&nbsp;24, 2008 to pay the forfeiture amount and until April&nbsp;22,
2008 to appeal the FCC&#146;s decision in a federal appellate court.&#160; We have been informed that the FOX network,
on behalf of its affiliates, will appeal the FCC&#146;s forfeiture order.&#160; Although we cannot predict the outcome of
that proceeding or the effect of any adverse outcome on the stations&#146; license
renewal applications, the FOX network has agreed to indemnify its affiliates
for the full amount of this liability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;15, 2006, the FCC issued an NAL in the
amount of $32,500 per station to a number of CBS affiliated and owned and
operated stations, including KGAN-TV in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.&#160; The NAL alleged that the stations broadcast
indecent material contained in an episode of &#147;Without a Trace,&#148; a CBS network
program that aired on December&nbsp;31, 2004 at 9:00&nbsp;p.m.&#160; CBS opposed the NAL but has not agreed to
indemnify its affiliates for the full amount of this liability, if any.&#160; We cannot predict the outcome of this
proceeding or the effect of any adverse outcome on the station&#146;s license
renewal application.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;11, 2006, the FCC sent a letter to us
requesting information regarding the broadcast of video news releases, by
WBFF-TV in Baltimore, Maryland, KOKH-TV in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, WLFL-TV in
Raleigh, North Carolina, WPGH-TV in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, WSYX-TV in
Columbus, Ohio, WVTV-TV in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and KGAN-TV in Cedar Rapids,
Iowa, without proper sponsorship identification in alleged violation of federal
law and the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; We denied that
the stations violated federal law or the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; The FCC&#146;s inquiry proceeding is currently
pending.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-34</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-34',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ci.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;7, 2006, the FCC sent a letter to us
requesting information regarding the broadcast of certain programs, by
forty-one stations licensed to us and three stations previously licensed to us,
without proper sponsorship identification in alleged violation of federal law
and the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; We denied that the
stations violated federal law or the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; On July&nbsp;23, 2007, the FCC dismissed the
complaints and closed its investigation with respect to thirty-five of the
stations.&#160; On October&nbsp;18, 2007, the
FCC issued a Notice of Apparent Liability for forfeiture, proposing to fine
nine of the stations a total of $36,000 for allegedly violating the sponsorship
identification rules.&#160; We opposed the FCC&#146;s
determination and the proceeding remains pending.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;26, 2007, the FCC sent letters to two of
our stations, WUHF-TV in Rochester, New York and WSYX-TV in Columbus, Ohio,
requesting information regarding the broadcast of certain video news releases
without proper sponsorship identification in alleged violation of federal law
and the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; We denied that the
stations violated federal law or the FCC&#146;s rules.&#160; The inquiry proceeding is currently in
process.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;1, 2007, the FCC sent a letter to WRLH-TV
in Richmond, Virginia, requesting information regarding the alleged broadcast
of indecent material during an advertisement.&#160;
We denied that the station broadcast indecent material.&#160; The inquiry proceeding is currently in
process.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;19, 2008, the FCC issued a forfeiture
order in the amount of $27,500 per station to a number of ABC affiliated and
owned and operated stations, including KDNL-TV in St. Louis, Missouri and
WEAR-TV in Mobile, Alabama.&#160; The order
concluded that the stations broadcast indecent material contained in a February&nbsp;25,
2003 episode of the ABC program &#147;NYPD Blue,&#148; that aired at 9:00pm.&#160; Under the order, the affected stations had
until February&nbsp;21, 2008 to pay the forfeiture amount and until April&nbsp;21,
2008 to appeal the FCC&#146;s decision in a federal appellate court.&#160; ABC paid the forfeiture amount on our
behalf.&#160; ABC has appealed the fine
imposed on the two ABC stations it owns and we are considering filing a similar
appeal with respect to the ABC affiliated stations that we own.&#160; While we cannot predict the outcome of this
proceeding, ABC will indemnify its affiliates for any liability, pursuant to
the affiliation agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Leases</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into operating leases for certain
property and equipment under terms ranging from three to ten years.&#160; The rent expense from continuing operations
under these leases, as well as certain leases under month-to-month
arrangements, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 was
approximately $5.0 million, $5.4 million and $4.6 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future minimum payments under the leases are as
follows (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.68%;">

  </td>

  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:72.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.34%;">

  </td>
  <td width="18%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18,520</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.68%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, we had outstanding
letters of credit of $0.4 million and $1.0 million, respectively, under our
revolving credit facility.&#160; The letters
of credit for 2007 act as support of the purchase of the license assets of
WNYS-TV in Syracuse, New York, pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement and
G1440&#146;s guarantee of lease payments pursuant to the terms and conditions of
their office lease agreement.&#160; In 2006,
we had an outstanding letter of credit as a guarantee of lease payments for the
related party property occupied by WTTA-TV in Tampa, Florida, pursuant to the
terms and conditions of the lease agreement.&#160;
There was no letter of credit outstanding for WTTA-TV as of December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Network
Affiliation Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our 58
television stations that we own and operate, or to which we provide programming
services or sales services, are affiliated as follows: FOX (20 stations);
MyNetworkTV (17 stations); ABC (9 stations); The CW (9 stations); CBS (2
stations) and NBC (1 station).&#160; The
networks produce and distribute programming in exchange for each station&#146;s
commitment to air the programming at specified times and for commercial
announcement time during programming.&#160;
The amount and quality of programming provided by each network varies.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The non-renewal or termination of any of our other
network affiliation agreements would prevent us from being able to carry
programming of the relevant network.&#160;
This loss of programming would require us to obtain replacement
programming, which may involve higher costs and which may not be as attractive
to our target audiences, resulting in reduced revenues.&#160; Upon </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-35</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-35',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ci.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the
termination of any of the above affiliation agreements, we would be required to
establish a new affiliation agreement with another network or operate as an
independent station.&#160; At such time, the
remaining value of the network affiliation asset could become impaired and we
would be required to write down the value of the asset.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Changes in the Rules&nbsp;on
Television Ownership and Local Marketing Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of our stations have entered into what have
commonly been referred to as local marketing agreements or LMAs.&#160; One typical type of LMA is a programming
agreement between two separately owned television stations serving the same
market, whereby the licensee of one station programs substantial portions of
the broadcast day and sells advertising time during such programming segments
on the other licensee&#146;s station subject to the ultimate editorial and other
controls being exercised by the latter licensee.&#160; We believe these arrangements allow us to
reduce our operating expenses and enhance profitability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 1999, the FCC established a new local television
ownership rule&nbsp;and decided to attribute LMAs for ownership purpose.&#160; It grandfathered our LMAs that were entered
into prior to November&nbsp;5, 1996, permitting the applicable stations to
continue operations pursuant to the LMAs until the conclusion of the FCC&#146;s 2004
biennial review.&#160; The FCC stated it would
conduct a case-by-case review of grandfathered LMAs and assess the
appropriateness of extending the grandfathering periods.&#160; Subsequently, the FCC invited comments as to
whether, instead of beginning the review of the grandfathered LMAs in 2004, it
should do so in 2006.&#160; The FCC did not
initiate any review of grandfathered LMAs in 2004 or as part of its 2006
quadrennial review.&#160; We do not know when,
or if, the FCC will conduct any such review of grandfathered LMAs.&#160; With respect to LMAs executed on or after November&nbsp;5,
1996, the FCC required that parties come into compliance with the 1999 local
television ownership rule&nbsp;by August&nbsp;6, 2001.&#160; We challenged the 1999 local television
ownership rule&nbsp;in the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit, and that
court stayed the enforcement of the divestiture of the post-November&nbsp;5,
1996 LMAs.&#160; In 2002, the D.C. Circuit
ruled in <i>Sinclair Broadcast Group,&nbsp;Inc. v. F.C.C</i>.,
284 F.3d 114 (D.C. Cir. 2002) that the 1999 local television ownership rule&nbsp;was
arbitrary and capricious and remanded the rule&nbsp;to the Commission.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2003, the FCC revised its ownership rules,
including the local television ownership rule. The effective date of the 2003
ownership rules&nbsp;was stayed by the U. S. Court of Appeals for the Third
Circuit and the rules&nbsp;were remanded to the FCC.&#160; Because the effective date of the 2003
ownership rules&nbsp;had been stayed and, in connection with the adoption of
those rules, the FCC concluded the 1999 rules&nbsp;could not be justified as
necessary in the public interest, we took the position that an issue exists
regarding whether the FCC has any current legal right to enforce any rules&nbsp;prohibiting
the acquisition of television stations.&#160;
Several parties, including us, filed petitions with the Supreme Court of
the United States seeking review of the Third Circuit decision, but the Supreme
Court denied the petitions in June&nbsp;2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;2006, as part of the FCC&#146;s statutorily
required quadrennial review of its media ownership rules, the FCC released a
Further Notice of Proposed Rule&nbsp;Making seeking comment on how to address
the issues raised by the Third Circuit&#146;s decision, among other things,
remanding the local television ownership rule.&#160;
In January&nbsp;2008, the FCC released an order containing its current
ownership rules, which re-adopted its 1999 local television ownership
rule.&#160; On February&nbsp;8, 2008, we filed
a petition with the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit requesting that
the Court direct the FCC to cease its use of the 1999 local television
ownership rule&nbsp;that it re-adopted as the permanent rule&nbsp;in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;15,
1999, we entered into a plan and agreement of merger to acquire through merger
WMYA-TV (formerly WBSC-TV) in Anderson, South Carolina from Cunningham
Broadcasting Corporation (Cunningham), but that transaction was denied by the
FCC.&#160; In light of the change in the 2003
ownership rules, we filed a petition for reconsideration with the FCC and
amended our application to acquire the license of WMYA-TV.&#160; We also filed applications in November&nbsp;2003
to acquire the license assets of the remaining five Cunningham stations:
WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio; WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WVAH-TV,
Charleston, West Virginia; WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland; and WTTE-TV, Columbus,
Ohio.&#160; Rainbow/PUSH filed a petition to
deny these five applications and to revoke all of our licenses.&#160; The FCC dismissed our applications in light
of the stay of the 2003 ownership rules&nbsp;and also denied the Rainbow/PUSH
petition.&#160; Rainbow/PUSH filed a petition
for reconsideration of that denial and we filed an application for review of the
dismissal.&#160; In 2005, we filed a petition
with the U. S. Court of Appeals for the D. C. Circuit requesting that the Court
direct the FCC to take final action on our applications, but that petition was
dismissed.&#160; On January&nbsp;6, 2006, we
submitted a motion to the FCC requesting that it take final action on our
applications.&#160; Both the applications and
the associated petition to deny are still pending.&#160; We believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition is
without merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If we are required to terminate or modify our LMAs,
our business could be affected in the following ways:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Losses on investments</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
As part of our LMA arrangements, we own the non-license assets used by
the stations with which we have LMAs.&#160; If
certain of these LMA arrangements are no longer permitted, we would be forced
to sell these assets, restructure our agreements or find another use for
them.&#160; If this happens, the market for
such assets may not be as good as when we purchased them and, therefore, we
cannot be certain that we will recoup our original investments.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-36</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-36',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ci.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Termination penalties</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160;
If the FCC requires us to modify or terminate existing LMAs before the
terms of the LMAs expire, or under certain circumstances, we elect not to
extend the terms of the LMAs, we may be forced to pay termination penalties
under the terms of some of our LMAs.&#160; Any
such termination penalty could be material.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity Assurance</font></i></b></h2>

<h2 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;26,
2005, we entered into a twelve-month limited scope liquidity assurance with
Acrodyne Communications,&nbsp;Inc. (Acrodyne), one of our majority-owned
consolidated subsidiaries.&#160; On July&nbsp;14,
2006, we extended the liquidity assurance for an additional twelve-month
period.&#160; Pursuant to this agreement, we
provided Acrodyne sufficient funding to cover any necessary working capital
needs through May&nbsp;25, 2007, when Acrodyne could not provide that funding
on its own.&#160; In connection with this
liquidity assurance, we established a $0.5 million line of credit for
Acrodyne.&#160; Interest on any unpaid indebtedness
is calculated on a daily basis at LIBOR plus 225 basis points per annum.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, Acrodyne had
borrowed $0.5 million under this line of credit.&#160; The liquidity assurance was not extended in
2007.&#160; We provide no liquidity assurance
to any of our other operating division companies or real estate venture
investment entities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>RELATED
PERSON TRANSACTIONS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">David, Frederick, Duncan and Robert Smith
(collectively, the controlling shareholders) are brothers and hold
substantially all of the Class&nbsp;B Common Stock.&#160; During each of the periods presented in the
accompanying consolidated financial statements, we engaged in transactions with
them, their immediate family members and/or entities in which they have substantial
interests (collectively, affiliates).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes and capital leases payable to affiliates
consisted of the following as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concurrently with our
initial public offering, we acquired options from trusts established by Carolyn
C. Smith, a parent of our controlling shareholders, for the benefit of her
grandchildren that will grant us the right to acquire, subject to applicable
FCC rules&nbsp;and regulations, 100% of the capital stock of Cunningham
Broadcasting Corporation (Cunningham).&#160;
The Cunningham option exercise price is based on a formula that provides
a 10% annual return to Cunningham.&#160;
Cunningham is the owner-operator and FCC licensee of: WNUV-TV,
Baltimore, Maryland; WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio; WVAH-TV, Charleston, West Virginia;
WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WMYA-TV (formerly WBSC-TV), Anderson,
South Carolina; and WTTE-TV, Columbus, Ohio.&#160;
The financial statements for Cunningham are included in our consolidated
financial statements for all periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-37</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-37',FILE='C:\JMS\pmarsha\08-2529-1\task2741019\2529-1-ci.htm',USER='pmarsha',CD='Feb 29 01:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We entered into five-year
LMA agreements (with five-year renewal terms at our option) with Cunningham
pursuant to which we provide programming to Cunningham for airing on WNUV-TV,
WRGT-TV, WVAH-TV, WTAT-TV, WMYA-TV and WTTE-TV.&#160;
During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, we made
payments of $7.8 million, $11.3 million and $7.0 million, respectively, to
Cunningham under these LMA agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cunningham accounts for
income taxes and deferred taxes using the separate return method and those
amounts are consolidated into our income taxes and deferred taxes, which are
also calculated using the separate return method.&#160; For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007
and 2005, Cunningham&#146;s provision for income taxes was $1.1 million and $0.6
million, respectively.&#160; For the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, Cunningham&#146;s benefit for income taxes was $0.2
million.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007
and 2006, Cunningham&#146;s deferred tax assets were $1.5 million and $2.2 million,
respectively and Cunningham&#146;s deferred tax liabilities were $6.3 million and
$5.8 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, we charter aircraft owned by
certain controlling shareholders.&#160; We
incurred less than $0.1 million related to these arrangements during each of
the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain assets used by us and our operating
subsidiaries are leased from Cunningham Communications Inc., Keyser Investment
Group, Gerstell Development Limited Partnership and Beaver Dam, LLC (entities
owned by the controlling shareholders).&#160;
Lease payments made to these entities were $5.2 million, $5.4 million
and $4.9 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;1999, we
entered into a local marketing agreement (LMA) with Bay Television,&nbsp;Inc.
(Bay TV), which owns the television station WTTA-TV in Tampa, Florida.&#160; Our controlling shareholders own a
substantial portion of the equity of Bay TV.&#160;
The LMA provides that we deliver television programming to Bay TV, which
broadcasts the programming in return for a monthly fee to Bay TV of
$143,500.&#160; We must also make an annual
payment equal to 50% of the adjusted annual broadcast cash flow of the station
(as defined in the LMA) that is in excess of $1.7 million.&#160; The additional payment is reduced by 50% of
the adjusted broadcast cash flow of the station that was below zero in prior
calendar years until that amount is recaptured.&#160;
Additional payments of $1.8 million, $0.9 million and $0.4 million were
made during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively,
related to the excess adjusted broadcast cash flow for the prior years.&#160; Lease payments made to Bay TV were $1.7
million for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with our 1997 negotiations with The WB
to obtain affiliation agreements for a number of our stations, we discussed an
opportunity to obtain The WB affiliation in Tampa, Florida for WTTA-TV, which
is owned by Bay TV as described above.&#160;
We did this in anticipation of entering into a LMA with Bay TV to
program WTTA-TV, which was then operating as a non-affiliated independent
television station airing paid programming.&#160;
In 1998, in order to obtain The WB affiliation for WTTA-TV, we and Bay
TV each agreed to make payments in the future to The WB of $10.0 million, or
$20.0 million in total.&#160; Our agreement to
make such payment was conditioned upon Bay TV entering into the aforementioned
LMA agreement, which we subsequently entered into in January&nbsp;1999.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our obligation to make a $10.0 million payment to The
WB was structured as a $5.0 million reduction of each of the payments owed to
us by The WB under our multi-station affiliation agreement in January&nbsp;of
each of 2006 and 2007, assuming that The WB was still operating a television
network at the time such payments were due.&#160;
Additionally, Bay TV agreed to make $5.0 million cash payments to The WB
in January&nbsp;2006 and January&nbsp;2007 pursuant to the granting of The WB
affiliation for WTTA-TV.&#160; Additionally,
our multi-station WB affiliation agreement provides that The WB&#146;s obligation to
make a $5.0 million payment to us in each of January&nbsp;2006 and 2007 is
expressly conditioned upon receipt by The WB of corresponding payments from Bay
TV.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After Bay TV failed to
make the first $5.0 million payment to The WB on its due date of January&nbsp;16,
2006, The WB withheld $5.0 million from the amount due to us pursuant to our
multi-station affiliation agreement. On January&nbsp;24, 2006, The WB announced
that it was combining with the UPN television network to form the CW Television
Network.&#160; As a result, we entered into
negotiations with The WB regarding a number of issues surrounding The WB&#146;s
announcement, including the impact of the elimination of WTTA-TV&#146;s WB network
affiliation and the amount we and Bay TV agreed to pay for the affiliation in
Tampa.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of such negotiations, on May&nbsp;2, 2006,
we entered into primary affiliation agreements with the CW Television
Network.&#160; Concurrently, we entered into a
release and settlement agreement between us and Bay TV, on one side, and The WB
and UPN, on the other side (the Release and Settlement Agreement).&#160; Pursuant to the Release and Settlement
Agreement, we and Bay TV agreed to release The WB and UPN, and The WB and UPN
agreed to release us and Bay TV, from any claims or other liabilities we or Bay
TV, or The WB or UPN, may have arising out of or in connection with (a)&nbsp;any
agreement, including any affiliation agreements entered into by us or Bay TV
with The WB or UPN, and (b)&nbsp;any services previously performed by any one
of the parties to the Release and Settlement Agreement for any other party to
the Release and Settlement Agreement.&#160;&#160;
In addition, pursuant to the Release and Settlement Agreement, The WB
assigned to us all of The WB&#146;s rights to receive a $5.0 million payment from
Bay TV on January&nbsp;16, 2006.&#160;&#160; In
connection with executing the Release and Settlement Agreement and entering
into the CW Television Network affiliation agreements, The WB and UPN agreed to
make a payment to us and, on May&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-38</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,
2006, we entered into an agreement with Bay TV (the Bay TV Agreement) in which
we agreed to pay Bay TV $750,000, representing Bay TV&#146;s share of the payment
made to us by The WB and UPN.&#160; This
payment was made by reducing by $750,000 Bay TV&#146;s obligation to pay us $5.0
million, which obligation was assigned to us by The WB as described above.&#160; We received the remaining $4.3 million
obligation as of December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We sold advertising time to and purchased vehicles and
related vehicle services from Atlantic Automotive Corporation (Atlantic
Automotive), a holding company which owns automobile dealerships and a leasing
company.&#160; David D. Smith, our President
and Chief Executive Officer, has a controlling interest in Atlantic Automotive
and is a member of the Board of Directors.&#160;
Our stations in Baltimore, Maryland and Norfolk, Virginia received
payments for advertising time totaling $0.6 million, $0.3 million and $0.5
million during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; We paid $1.1 million, $1.1
million and $1.0 million for vehicles and related vehicle services from
Atlantic Automotive during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and
2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;1999, we made an investment of $2.4
million in Allegiance Capital Limited Partnership (Allegiance), a small
business investment company.&#160; Our
controlling shareholders and our Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice
President are also investors in Allegiance, along with Allegiance Capital
Management Corporation (ACMC), the general partner.&#160; ACMC controls all decision making, investing
and management of operations of Allegiance in exchange for a monthly management
fee based on actual expenses incurred which currently averages approximately
$0.1 million and which is paid by the limited partners.&#160; Allegiance distributed $2.0 million and $7.0
million to us during 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, our investment
balance was $9.2 million and our remaining unfunded commitment was $5.3
million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;1, 2005, Sinclair Communications, LLC
(Sinclair Communications), a subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group,&nbsp;Inc.
(SBG), and Cunningham Communications,&nbsp;Inc. (Cunningham Communications)
entered into Amendment No.&nbsp;2 to an original Lease Agreement (the Lease),
dated July&nbsp;1, 1987, as amended July&nbsp;1, 1997.&#160; Amendment No.&nbsp;2 became effective July&nbsp;1,
2005 and expired on June&nbsp;30, 2007.&#160;
Cunningham Communications is owned by our controlling shareholders.&#160; The Lease was amended to increase the monthly
rent by $25,357 for a total current monthly rent of $82,860.&#160; In addition, on July&nbsp;1, 2005, Sinclair
Communications made a lump sum payment of $565,800 to Cunningham Communications
as a requirement upon execution of Amendment No.&nbsp;2.&#160; The monthly rent increased in July&nbsp;of
2006 to $86,984.&#160; On October&nbsp;11,
2007, Sinclair Communications and Cunningham Communications entered into
Amendment No.&nbsp;3.&#160; Amendment No.&nbsp;3,
effective July&nbsp;1, 2007, allows Sinclair Communications to lease tower and
building space utilized for digital television transmission.&#160; The monthly rent decreased in July&nbsp;of
2007 to $60,976.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basil A. Thomas, a member of our board of directors,
is of counsel to Thomas&nbsp;&amp; Libowitz and the father of Steven A. Thomas,
a partner and founder of Thomas&nbsp;&amp; Libowitz.&#160; We paid fees of $0.7 million and $0.5 million
to Thomas&nbsp;&amp; Libowitz during 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; During 2007, Steven A. Thomas received, in
lieu of cash payment for certain legal fees, an ownership percentage in two of
our real estate investments and one of our private equity investments.&#160; The fair value of the three ownership
interests was $0.1 million as of the dates the investments were made.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS</font></u></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with SFAS
144, <i>Accounting for the Impairment or
Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</i>, we reported the financial position
and results of operations for WGGB-TV in Springfield, Massachusetts, WEMT-TV in
Tri-Cities, Tennessee, KOVR-TV in Sacramento, California and KSMO-TV in Kansas
City, Missouri as assets and liabilities held for sale in the accompanying
consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements of operations.&#160; Discontinued operations have not been
segregated in the consolidated statements of cash flows and, therefore, amounts
for certain captions will not agree with the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets and consolidated statements of operations.&#160; The operating results of WGGB-TV, WEMT-TV,
KOVR-TV and KSMO-TV are not included in our consolidated results from
continuing operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and
2005.&#160; In accordance with EITF No.&nbsp;87-24,
<i>Allocation of Interest to Discontinued
Operations</i>, we have allocated $3.6 million of interest expense to
discontinued operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; No interest expense was allocated for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.&#160;
Since we owned the rights to collect the amounts due to us through the
closing dates of the non-license television broadcast assets, accounts
receivable related to all of our discontinued operations is included in the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets, net of allowance for doubtful
accounts, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.&#160; Such amounts were $0.1 million (net of
allowance of less than $0.1 million) and $1.5 million (net of allowance of $0.1
million), respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-39</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WGGB Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;31, 2007, we
entered into an agreement to sell WGGB-TV, including the FCC license, to an
unrelated third party for $21.2 million in cash.&#160; The FCC approved the transfer of the
broadcast license and the sale was completed on November&nbsp;1, 2007.&#160; We recorded $1.1 million, net of $0.5 million
tax provision, as gain from discontinued operations in our consolidated
statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160; The net cash proceeds were used in the normal
course of operations and for capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WEMT Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;16, 2005, we entered into an agreement to
sell WEMT-TV, including the FCC license to an unrelated third party for $7.0
million.&#160; On the same day, we completed
the sale of the WEMT-TV non-license television broadcast assets for $5.6
million of the total $7.0 million sale price and recorded a deferred gain of
$3.2 million.&#160; The FCC approved the
transfer of the broadcast license to the unrelated third party and we completed
the sale of the license assets, including the broadcast license, on February&nbsp;8,
2006 for a cash price of approximately $1.4 million.&#160; We recorded $1.8 million, net of $0.9 million
in taxes, as gain from discontinued operations in our consolidated statements
of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The gain is comprised of the previously
deferred gain of $2.1 million and the loss of $0.3 million from the sale of the
license assets, net of taxes, respectively.&#160;
The net cash proceeds were used in the normal course of operations and
for capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">KOVR Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;2, 2004, we entered into an agreement
to sell KOVR-TV, including the FCC license and our investment in KOVR Joint
Venture to an unrelated third party.&#160; The
FCC approved the transfer of the broadcast license to the unrelated third party
and we completed the sale on April&nbsp;29, 2005 for a cash purchase price of
$285.0 million.&#160; We recorded a gain of
$129.5 million, net of $70.0 million of taxes, as a gain from discontinued
operations in our consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160; The net proceeds were used to
repay bank debt.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">KSMO Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;12, 2004, we entered into an
agreement to sell KSMO-TV, including the FCC license to an unrelated third party
for $33.5 million.&#160; On the same day, we
completed the sale of the KSMO-TV non-license television broadcast assets for
$26.8 million of the total $33.5 million sale price.&#160; The FCC approved the transfer of the
broadcast license to the unrelated third party and we completed the sale of the
license assets, including the broadcast license, on September&nbsp;29, 2005 for
a cash price of approximately $6.7 million.&#160;
We recorded $16.5 million, net of $10.0 million in taxes, as gain from
discontinued operations in our consolidated statements of operations for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; The
gain is comprised of the previously deferred gain of $26.1 million and the gain
of $0.4 million from the sale of the license assets, net of taxes,
respectively.&#160; The net cash proceeds were
used in the normal course of operations and for capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-40</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><u><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EARNINGS PER SHARE</font></u></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">:</font></b></p>

years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 (in thousands):</font></p>
